Review.Contenu: I only signed up for this yesterday and have decided to cancel becuase I just couldn't import all my data from a csv file (I have managed to do that easily with 1Password) but they still want to charge me a full year - outrageous! I thought you were supposed to get a grace period when buying online?  Obviously they don't pay any attention to that!

Review.Titre: I have been going round in circles
Review.Contenu: I have been going round in circles. I had not intended to renew my premium subscription but Dashlane renewed it and took payment 2 days early. I have raised customer support requests asking for a refund but no response despite multiple requests. I have tried the chat but the bot doesn’t want to connect me with a person. Not impressed

Review.Titre: You never got back to me after over a…
Review.Contenu: You never got back to me after over a month. I'm looking for a new service. When I do I'll be cancelling

Review.Titre: I have paid for my premium membership
Review.Contenu: I have paid for my premium membership.  I keep getting emails from you saying my premium membership is expiring soon.  And now, I just got an email saying my premium membership has expired. You need a phone number.  When I log into Dashlane. It says my Premium Membership renews in. November 2024.  Can you please correct whatever is going wrong there and give me some kind of message that  y account is secure and paid?  Geeze.  I don’t need this crap.

Review.Titre: I have paid for the whole year to…
Review.Contenu: I have paid for the whole year to Dashlane but they customer keep sending me the emails for payment again, also now is more difficult to use the dashlane

I installed the Dashlane app briefly a while back while assessing password apps but found a better fit. I just can’t get away from their mailing list no matter how many times I try to unsubscribe though. A little worrying as they manage so much personal data

Review.Titre: I was satisfied with Dashlane until…
Review.Contenu: I was satisfied with Dashlane until about 10 days ago then things really went to pot. I am using a MacBook and was asked to download Sonoma 14.0 After I did that, things went a little bit off with many programs but after a day all things self corrected except Dashlane. All my logins (I have over 100 of them) are randomly placed, not in alphabetical order  any more. I have to hunt one by one looking for the password I want. Made four calls to technical help, all say we are aware of your problem and it is in the queue. We cannot tell you when it will be fixed. I even wrote them yesterday, never heard back. This does not inspire much confidence in the technical capacity of people in a company who are supposedly guarding your access security !

Review.Titre: Dashlane is great until you have a…
Review.Contenu: Dashlane is great until you have a problem.  My phone broke and I got a new one.  The authenticator app does not transfer to new phones for security reasons.  The Dashlane recovery codes did not work( they were very old) or kept registering as having been used which is inaccurate.  I contacted Dashlane.  You would think I was asking for nuclear launch codes.  The questions they asked were impossible to answer. They were intransigent.  They locked my account and refused to send a code to my phone so I could open it.  I will have to reset the passwords for dozens of sites.  I had to cancel my account and will not be opening a new one.

Not a user, but got marketing email from them (not sure how they got my email as it is not public one), then asked how they got my email address and then - radio silent. Day later - another marketing email completely ignoring my first request on how they got my email address. If they do not respond to those simple questions, is it worth using them for those who needs? Rhetorical question

Annoying, irrelevant login pop ups combined with horrendous customer ‘support’. Install this app with caution. You will waste a minimum of 100 hours per year. The old desktop Dashlane worked perfectly. The Chrome extension makes me want to scream, daily.

so apparently, each login on a google chrome browser on the same device counts as a new device. you cannot use their tool on separate windows on the same device even though that's what they advertise on their marketing pages. looks scammy and misleading advertising to me. All to push you to pay annual fees to use the tool they claim you can use for free.Also, was put on a free trial for their premium features without being consulted. Careful. dont give them your CCs

Review.Titre: Don't Ask me Not to Use the Safari Browser
Review.Contenu: My desktop computer is a new MacBook Air M2, running the OS Ventura 13.2.1 operating system and utilizing the Safari browser. This week, I tried accessing Dashlane which has been working just fine. No longer. Worse, I get a message from Dashlane suggesting I jump through a bunch of hoops for some extension but, better yet, stop using Safari and go with Google Chrome. I am not going to do that and it is drastically altering my opinion on Dashlane which I've been a very satisfied customer of until now.

They updated my extention layout and my app to add LGBT colors and i dont have a problem with that in their website or profiles but ever since it started lagging and the search bar in the extension app is not functioning anymore. you can make marketing things all you want but please... not on my app i want it as smooth as it gets as private as it gets. stop. stop failing after your success. im waiting for my annual subscription to finish to switch to open source manager.

The representative was helpful, but the process for a paid subscription was unacceptable in my opinion.  You can only Chat or email, no phone call can be done.  It takes so long for a person who cannot type very well to have ALL COMMUNICAITON back and forth by typing.  It took probably 5 times longer than it should have taken compared to talking on the phone.

No access to customer service.  Text capability hidden.Having problems with Auto Fill for weeks.  I am sure a simple fix but no respond from text messaging to resolve issues They have no problem sending reminders that yearly subscription fees are coming.

I have been very happy with Dashlane until I encountered a usage problem with the software.  They do not support a live person chat, instead have a bot.  There is no way to call them.  If you text them or get in an email session days go by before a response.  i am looking for an alternative.

Dashlane has been steadily removing useful features across the board since I subscribed, it's my lasting regret that I purchased an annual plan and am unable to cancel for a partial refund because the service and lack of features of shocking. I attempted to setup the VPN to at least get some use out of the membership, but uBlock Origin prevented the download due to harmful trackers to a data analytics company. Not a great idea for a privacy and security based service. Stay clear, there are so many better solutions out there.

Dashlane, changing passwords deletes email addressI did already write but no reply?I changed my password for the 3 email accountsAfter not able to login all day yesterday for one.then today for other 2.Something in your software is not functioning? SEE ATTACHED, the 2nd 1 is yesterday.I had to wait 24 hrs to get back my email from .comThis is no joke for me.ticket no. 2025155

I pay for the premium subscription, and for the last 3 weeks I have been locked out of the desktop version (stating I have the wrong password) however I have access to the mobile app and my password works on mobile. The customer support team provided redundant solutions that don't work, I've worked several hours trying to fix the issue. Some of the stuff they have asked me to do you can't do on mobile. I gave up after much wasted time and asked for a refund, they said they don't issue refunds despite the fact that I can't use the password manager as is (and trying to troubleshoot for over two weeks).

If I could give this less than one star, I would. I’m not kidding when I say that between every button I push or letter I type when using the ap I have to wait like 60 seconds at least. It’s soo slow. I finally reached out about it and they told me they fixed it so I need to re-install the ap and if that still doesn’t work to clear my browser history- I did both, and nothing changed. I messaged them back saying it didn’t help and then they just never responded. I’m in the process of trying to switch back to last pass and it’s going to take years to copy and paste these passwords bc dash lane is sooo slow, literally making me go insane. Do NOT use dash lane

Review.Titre: Unfixable Bugs & Little Help From The Customer Team
Review.Contenu: I've been really disappointed with Dashlane's product; it doesn't work as advertised and I've been refused a refund.After a successful trial, I purchased 22 seats to roll out Dashlane to the small company I run.As soon as I switched from the free trial to paying member, I discovered a bug where logins and passwords I'd saved in my business space weren't visible/shareable with my team - the whole point of the software.I flagged this to customer support who offered several solutions, none of which worked. I was then told that the engineering team were 'deprioritising' my issue.I've asked for my account to be deleted and to start again, I've offered to switch plans, I've followed every instruction given to me, but to no avail.It's now nearly 5 months later and nothing has been done. Customer support have been friendly on email, but haven't solved the issue - when asking for my membership to be paused until this is sorted out, or my renewal date to be extended, or eventually asking for a refund now that my patience is exhausted, I've been refused and told 'after 30 days, there are no refunds.'Please use another service like 1Password or NordPass instead and save yourself the hassle - I'll be over here in Dashlane purgatory with my unused 21 seats.

No human support whatsoever!  Can not get desktop application to work!  Spent hours trying and even Apple support could not get to function!  Has for years then went nipples up on me and cannot get to work as did

Review.Titre: I closed my account with Dashlane as it…
Review.Contenu: I closed my account with Dashlane as it was more trouble than it was worth.  Had many problems and no customer support.  Now 5 years later they are trying to process payment.  Thank god my credit card has changed.

Review.Titre: Dashlane Customer support, Data and oblivious Web app
Review.Contenu: So let me start off with how bad the Web client is for dashlane, the fact that you have to log in like 2 times every browser session + dashlane authenticator for that you also have to log in again.Bought the premium subscription last year and it ended like a week ago, now all of my 'data' basically vanished from my accounts, no data was saved or transfered by dashlane online databases and the customer service literallyqouted 'When unlinking your previous device, all your data should be uploaded to the new device. ' saying 'should' meaning they themselves are not sure if the data is transferred. If these statements alone don't convince you to choose otherwiseI guess try it yourself and save hundreads of passwords and after a year find a new alternative like 'Bitwarden', thus cancelling your subscription with them and 'literally' losing all your passwords with no way of getting them back since the support doesn't know either on how to get them back.Let's not forget the web client has a flaw where if you use any other browser apart the ones they support, YOU will have to log in every single time and won't be able to use the feature 'save login info for 14 days' this service is a joke.Forget this app and just get 'bitwarden' or 'keepass' like they're free, offer same or more value for free and have better customer support. Probably even bought their reviews on trustpilot. Serious accusation, its probably true.
After using this app for 3 yrs, all of a sudden lost all passwords and secure notes.. I have logged  a support ticket but its been 2 days and no response...
Several times for the past month I have tried to cancel my subscription, to no avail. I keep getting robo type responses, that are of no help. PLEASE CANCEL MY SUBSCRIPTION!

Review.Titre: Once i installed this i was forced…
Review.Contenu: Once i installed this i was forced logged out of all my accounts. Is that suppose to be a smooth transition? it created me a whole load of work. Absolute trash.
Absolutely the worst customer service I’ve ever dealt with in my life. Can not get application back up and running on my Mac.

Review.Titre: I sent two messages to Dashlane 5 and 3…
Review.Contenu: I sent two messages to Dashlane 5 and 3 days ago. No response and no other way to get in touch with them.  I am missing the D logo and don't know how to get it back.  Terrible customer service.

Review.Titre: They do not want anyone to talk…
Review.Contenu: They do not want anyone to talk directly with a HUMAN BEING, everything is a BOT!No phone number to call !
Took weeks to get help, no live person, i had to figure it out myself. Dashlane support is the worst in the industry. I will have to leave

Horrendous!Dashlane is a great app when it works! But when it doesn't-My oh My!!!!!!!When I upgraded to a new iPhone I was no longer able to access my Dashlane account or any of my passwords or information! What followed was almost 5 weeks of time-consuming, frustrating, and excruciating email correspondence where I felt myself going around in circles. While not the world's leading tech-savvy person I do regard myself as having basic competency and despite following the instructions given was not able to rectify the problem on m y own and needed assistance. I was expected to respond within 3 hours to verification codes sent to my email. The problem was I am in a different time zone to the Dashlane technicians and they were not able to schedule for the code to be sent to me at what might have been a reasonable time in my time zone!I could not get to talk to a technician by phone to help guide me through the process of trying to resolve the problem (despite making this request several times and providing contact details!!!). While I appreciate the need for strict security and would not want anything other than strict security for my passwords -I was expected to remember the exact date the account was opened which was over 5 years ago, the number of log-ins I had, and the exact date that my last log-in was! I might have been able to answer these security questions if I had been able to access my account!  They would not take into account any other information I tried to provide or the fact that I knew the Master Password!After demanding help from higher management, a second technical assistant finally helped me sort the information out from their side which I appreciated.I am not in the habit of writing bad reviews but this experience was so excruciating that I felt I needed to share my experience.

Review.Titre: Only response was from a robot
Review.Contenu: Only response was from a robot. Response had nothing to do with the problem.

Basically I wanted to cancel my subscription but you have to pay one month extra in order to see cancel subscription buttons. It is not fair that I have paid 1 month extra for a subscription that I will not use at all.

Review.Titre: bad service i will never use and…
Review.Contenu: bad service i will never use and recommend again
Customer service was none existent. They didn't even read my submission when responding.

Review.Titre: Still waiting on the issue to be resolved

Review.Contenu: Inattentive inconvenient robotic response of no value—-had to pay local tech to solve problem.

Review.Titre: If you forget the master password you…
Review.Contenu: If you forget the master password you are screwed. You must start all over again and reset all of your sites. Also, will intercept your every attempt to log on by blocking the log on info. I'm an old man and have a habit of forgetting passwords. Dashlane has declared me as an enemy.

Becoming a really bad software recently. I sent a message about a bug in their extension, they literally didn't read and pasted a huge template copy paste that basically "Do what you are already doing and then it should work", but it doesn't, that's why I reported the bug. Becoming a BS company with corporate copy-paste. Time to switch.
CONTINUED INABILITY TO CONSISTENTLY HAVE DASHLANE OPERATE SUCCESSFULLY! AS OF THE LAST THREE DAYS DASHLANE HAS BEEN INACCESSIBLE!!!!!!

Every time I want to login to my host gator account this dash lane pop up to offer to save my password. And I click not show again and there it is again. Horrible thing .Fair enough if you try to fix. I use ccleaner browser. Search engine duckduckgo, and the pup up appear every time . I got no account with you, never looked you up, just started to offer to remember my password. I clic never show again and yet it does every time !

Review.Titre: Dashlane locked me out on two platforms
Review.Contenu: I'm a Premium member and I've had the same master password for years.  Last Friday, I was unable to access Dashlane (password rejected).  Dashlane support said that I must have forgotten my password but fortunately for me, I could prove I had not as I kept this password on an encrypted file in my safe.  Dashlane could offer no explanation why their software disabled my access (on their windows app and also on their iPhone app), and they stopped responding to me after 24 hours.  I would not renew my subscription.  (AFTER READING THEIR REPLY) STATING: "it's usually due to an issue with how the extension, or app, was originally installed or how it communicated with a recent update - a reinstall of the extension, or app, resolves this."  Please note that this occurred at the same time on two totally different apps so their response has no merit.

Review.Titre: Do NOT enroll in their autopay!
Review.Contenu: Do NOT enroll in their autopay!I received email from Dashlane stating in 30 days an autopay would occur.  I immediately sent an email to Dashlane support to cancel my autopay and subscription. Having not heard from Dashlane after 2 weeks, I sent another email cancelling subscription and autopay.On day of autopay, I received an email that I had been charged for another year of Dashlane! Included in the email was a link to Paypal to cancel the autopay. These instructions were NOT in the original email.  My Paypal account did show a charge was already made from Dashlane.Oct 6 response to Dashlane reply:* It would have been nice to have received your response after my first email to Dashlane support in early Sept.* The email warning of the impending auto renew charge stated the charge would occur    Oct 18.  My Paypal got charged on Oct 1.  Another devious business practice.

Review.Titre: I've historically been an advocate for…
Review.Contenu: I've historically been an advocate for Dashlane as I found their app to be one of the better password managers in the market but their platform has drastically declined in quality in the past year or so.After years as a paid user, it seems as though technical issues are becoming more frequent and increasingly frustrating.I'm now experiencing the 3rd or 4th time (this year) where I cannot access my passwords due to technical errors on their end - which is unacceptable on a costly premium plan. Unfortunately, I'll be moving on to another password manager.

I have tried to contact Dashlane but there is no email address and the only contact form is for business only demanding company details.I recently started getting a dashlane reminder window every time i logged into different websites, a reminder to log into Dashlane password manager. Which i do not have or use, I cannot find any reference on my comp, it is very annoying, i feel HIjacked and disgusted.

Review.Titre: Used to be great but prices sucks
Review.Contenu: I’ve been using Dashlane for a few years now. It’s really great, very secure and works well. But I started with the premium account for about $23 and it increased till it reached $60. Which almost double the price of all competitors. They restricted the promocodes to only new customers which is such a greedy move. So eventually I had to switch to another brand that is reasonably priced and offers the same. I wish I could stick with Dashlane since I’m already familiar with and liked but the way they are going with the pricing I believe I’m not going to be the last one.

I have used Dashlane for several years and have been satisfied. However, in the last month, they have locked me out of my account, sending me a pop up message that my master password in invalid. Of course, they want me to upgrade to their premium plan for additional money or I will no longer have access to my passwords. The anxiety and stress that this has caused me is unbelievable because now I am unable to access my important accounts because Dashlane is holding my passwords hostage unless I pay up. How can they do this? Isn't there some sort of law that prohibits this type of greedy move by a corporation?

Review.Titre: The web app is complete rubbish
Review.Contenu: The web app is complete rubbish. When setting up passwords (temp) for customers it was really easy enough to generate, copy and paste. Now it's an absolute nightmare. Why did they not include a password generator as a separate function within the app without having to generate from within the password field?And that's not the only gripe, it's now clumsy and intrusive.I'm throwing away almost a full year sub just to get rid of this terrible password manager

Review.Titre: Dashlane progressively gets worse over time and removes features. Don't invest your data with them.
Review.Contenu: When I first got Dashlane I loved it. This was back when there was a desktop app. Then Dashlane decided to migrate away from a desktop app to a web app only. Since then a number of critical and important features have been lost, and yet the price of Dashlane has not fallen. You can NO LONGER set an EMERGENCY CONTACT. You can NO LONGER easily sign in with 2FA without going through a separate app first.  You can NO LONGER create CUSTOM Categories within the app to organize your data. A company that continues to REMOVE features and worsen their offering will not sustain for long. If I could do it all again I'd set up a KEEPER account. They are very similar, but they have maintained many of the features I describe above that Dashlane decided to stop.

Review.Titre: I cannot find anyone to cancel my subscription
Review.Contenu: I though I had cancelled my subscription 2 years ago and haven't been able to.  I have never used it.  Then I was billed and gave up trying to reach anyone.  Then I got billed yesterday.  Again, I cannot reach anyone.  I tried logging into my account to delete it, but I discarded my master password thinking ti didn't need it anymore.  Cannot find a phone number or email address.  Nothng on the website.  Customer support does not return my messages.  Yesterday my customer support request bounced back as undeliverable.  I have spent HOURS on this.  Have reported them to the FTC.  I don't know what else to do.

Really poor service - their process for recovery if you forget your Master password is really poor.  The FaceID function didn't work, so their support team said they had literally no other way of resetting my password - they said I could recreate my account and reenter all my passwords (hundreds and hundreds) - appalling.  Their software doesn't work properly, customer left with no access! Avoid.

NO CUSTOMER SUPPORT!!!  I began using Dashlane and the next day I could not access any of the accounts for which I had used Dashlane's password generator.  I went online to see how to contact the company.  YOU CAN'T!  You have to send an e-mail or chat and then wait for them to respond (and hope that they do).  I lost a day's work because of this.  Use anyone else but Dashlane.

I have initiated a refund request through the Apple App Store.  You can not say your app is easy to use when it is not.  And of the false advertisement of it being easy is very misleading.To make matters worse, you actually expect customers to read through numerous manuals and written instructions to figure out how to use your non-user-friendly app.  And if that does not work, then you wants customers to reach out to you during their own Mon thru Friday working hours.  Or email you, wait 24 hours for a response and waste their time sending sending screen shots back and forth.No wonder you have so few subscribers.  Good lick with all that.  In my experience good companies, with good products, are able to provide free phone support.  They can do so because they have a good product that really is easy to use.

Review.Titre: The email address cannot be changed
Review.Contenu: The email address cannot be changed. Dashlane relies on external email boxes that they don't control. Someone wrongly designed the email as ID and users now have a problem. The only option is to set up a new Dashlane account to a new email address (Changing the contact email address does not solve the problem). Unfortunately, they cannot transfer a paid family license, so you have to buy a new one.

Review.Titre: dashlane is a complete piece of crap
Review.Contenu: dashlane is a complete piece of crap.  it doesn't save your passwords when you replace them, it doesn't let you log in on other devices if you change your master password. it's full of bugs, there's no support, and the basic functionality consistently fails to work leaving you not knowing what your passwords are. avoid at all costs, use anything else, including a piece of paper

If you never, I mean never require customer service, it is a good choice. Have been a customer for 6+ years. Their website hiccup upped and I now have 3 tickets and zero assistance going on 3 weeks and am a hostage. Your only hope is there website might answer your question. If not, you can reach a Customer Service rep in a chat, but if your problem is not instantly solvable, they might email you but they then go dark and you are nowhere.  Expensive service for zero, and I mean zero customer service.

WORST PASSWORD MANAGER EVER.They FORCE you to install their desktop app to activate 2 FACTOR AUTHENTIFICATION (2FA). THEN they force you to enter your PHONE number to activate 2FA for sms (which is the most INSECURE way). SERIOUSLY ???Instantly uninstalled everything related to dashlane.

Review.Titre: Dashlane isn't what it claims to be
Review.Contenu: Dashlane seemed to work good initially.  I have been a customer for 2 years and really dislike it.  One day you have to log in multiple times in the same day other days you don't log in for days at a time.  It has screwed my passwords up with existing companies.  It's a poor app at best, I hope to find something better.  I hate paying for crap that doesn't work right and yet they charge you for it not a one time charge but yearly!!!!

Disappointing and frustrating ..... after trying for several months to get Dashlane functioning I learn from customer service that my Mac is too old and my IOS El Capitan is obsolete....I cancelled everything (but still struggle to get the Dashlane app removed from my Mac) and am using Norton 360 - easy and no problem.

Review.Titre: The product is deteriorating at a rapid…
Review.Contenu: The product is deteriorating at a rapid pace. The amount of logins to Dashlane itself is astonishing.I switched to 1Password, and asked Dashlane to verify that all my data has been removed from their servers. They reply, over a month later, telling me that I can try to start a chat on their site to get help.Sad to see a former rock star product get to this state.

Already several months I have been using Dashlane in the paid version, after good experiences with the free version. I started with a monthly fee and wanted to switch to an annual subscription. Now I have already paid the annual fee twice and they still, also, book my monthly fees. As I saw at other complainers, their customer service is a bot and further non-existing. You just do not get an answer when sending an e-mail.

Signed up for Dashlane only to find that my Ipad was too old to be used with it. I therefore asked for a refund but the service has been dismal. I've opened two tickets this week to get it sorted but all I have received is two automated responses and no refund.If you value even basic customer service avoid this company.Assuming Dashlane are listening to this review the ticket numbers are #1403421 and #1408044

Review.Titre: Features like autofill don't work as…
Review.Contenu: Features like autofill don't work as advertised on all my devices.The "priority support" that I pay for as part of my plan can't even respond within a full business day.Their "live chat" is useless and isn't even active during the hours posted on their own website (ex: says it's active until 6 PM, but they're not there at 4 PM)

Review.Titre: Used to love Dashlane but I would avoid…
Review.Contenu: Used to love Dashlane but I would avoid it now, they are focusing on a web only version and stopping support for the desktop app meaning if you are using anything that needs a password that is not in a browser e.g a games platform or other app with a login you have to use a web browser to find a password.  I often have dozens of web tabs open and finding dashlane is a nuisance when it used to be in the tray for immediate access.

I've bought a yearly subscription but apparently Dashlane isn't for me so I've asked for a 30-day refund guaranteed and moved to 1Password.However, it's been over two weeks since I've requested a refund (#1415140) and the ONLY answer I've got was from a bot. Nobody from the "Customer Service" cares to resolve my issue...

Review.Titre: Pay for Dashlane or Dont Touch
Review.Contenu: Advertised as free website that you can log into with your fingerprint. After a period of time this feature dissapeared. You then had to use password. After period of time it tells you your password is incorrect which had never changed. You have no way to reset password and you lose all your stored passwords(which are only stored on this site). Ordinary support given password has not changed.

I had a problem with a lost master password and contacted customer service via the on-line chat facility. Unfortunately after hours and hours of dialogue with Dashlane - the result was absolutely nothing, couldn’t help me. Very disappointed for a so called premium product - cancelled my account and moved on. Rubbish.

Review.Titre: Want to cancel? They screw you over.
Review.Contenu: I have cancelled Dashlane many months ago. However, they have recently deducted me $40. They have failed to respond to my refund requests. Just sent them a third request, this time, in form of a more legal text email.It is a huge pain trying to cancel with them. Even if you do, they might still take your money.They even went and responded to my Trustpilot review, telling me "AH YEAH WE CAN HELP", while failing to do so. Good job!

From my perspective, the only thing that made this more expensive product worth the extra money, was the ability to use Windows Hello fingerprint authentication to autofill passwords on websites. I paid for an annual subscription based on the assumption that feature would continue to be offered. This feature has now been removed without notice mid-subscription. I asked for a refund of my unspent subscription. This was refused.

This just doesnt work. Waste of money. It doesnt log in automatically on Mac and now on Windows every page has to be reloaded for Dashlane to even recognize the page exists and then it still wont login.There are much cheaper and better password tools with exactly the same functionality available today. If you want to avoid total frustration dont give Dashlane your money.

Review.Titre: This was awful.  Locked me out of my web-sites.
Review.Contenu: This was awful. Recommended by a friend.  I installed on my browser and it promptly auto-filled my web-sites with the wrong passwords. When I tried to suspend the autofill using the help instructions, it continued.  The help menus are pretty confusing as well.  A hopeless product. Stay  away from it.

Review.Titre: I deleted it from my PC where it had…
Review.Contenu: I deleted it from my PC where it had worked great and installed it on my iPhone where I could not get it to work. I found the explanations very confusing...so, I prefer not to use any there. Thanks.

Review.Titre: NO refund as promised within 30 days and NO replies to emails
Review.Contenu: While this company makes it easy to take your money when as in my case the product does not work like they say it will and offer a 30 day full refund I have tried numerous times to get my money back - they as others have found will just ignore your emails and are not forthcoming with my refund - and they keep sending me promotional emails for a service I could not use and do not want so AVOID THIS COMPANY

Tried to create an account using my sky account and it wouldn’t allow it as it was an “invalid email address” which it isn’t. I have also tried my AOL email address and created a new Outlook.com address and all fail with invalid email address. No faith in the product if they can’t get a basic registration process correct

I found that both the app and google chrome on my laptop, are at best, a hit or a miss. It will log you in automatically on one site, then the next day it wont work for the same site. It never auto fills my card details, even though I have two registered. The only thing I have found that Dashlane does, is constantly ask for the master password and try to upgrade me from the trial to Pro.  There is absolutely no customer service, you are just passed from one person to the next with no solutions provided.Its a fantastic idea and reasonably priced. But it just doesn't work.

The new web app, and Chrome Extension are absolutely atrocious. I have been using Dashlane for a number of years as a premium user and been happy. Latest update just makes it unusable. Sad to say I will have to look for an alternative this year. What a stupid idiotic move that will lose you many many customers.

Review.Titre: I quickly realised this service wasn't…
Review.Contenu: I quickly realised this service wasn't for me after they couldn't autofill in the android browser, however things took a turn for the worst when I requested a refund under my 30 day refund window, they refuse the request, and deleted my account. Then I sent a message to support to request it, it has taken them over a month to respond to say that my account doesn't exist (no sh.. sherlock) so they can't process my request. Absolutely incompetent and useless service with a sup par app and horribly slow service.

I wanted to buy, but its stupid to be forced a VPN, what about the people that already got a VPN, better one infact, i want a password manager, nothing more, so why pay that huge amount for a Password manager, just because it got a VPN that isent even great, so make a damn optional Dashlane without that s.. VPN plz and you may actually be worth it for many more people, but for now i go with another product, like so many other..

Review.Titre: Total frustration, it sucks the life force out of you
Review.Contenu: 'Premium subscription' means wasting half your life trying to manage Dashlane and figuring out how to get to your online accounts. The constant pop-ups are annoying, but not as bad as Dashlane offering to 'generate a strong password" with which I either can't log in, or when I can actually log in, Dashlane hasn't saved the particular pw in my account. Never have i payed for a service to feel so frustrated. Except maybe at a downtown McDonalds counter.

Don't botherThis was in my opinion the best password manager - but they have downgraded it from what used to be a fully featured product to a clunky buggy web app which they have introduced pending deprecation of their desktop app. They have even moved to providing useless support via an AI bot.

Don't bother with this, the software is rubbish.The only, and only plus side is that you can at least copy and paste your saved passwords, if you know where to find and unhide them, when dashlane doesn't fill it in.So glad i didn't bother with the premium version.There has to be something better, surely?

Review.Titre: This was relatively useful but is useless since the change.
Review.Contenu: This used to be a relatively useful password manager, however frustrating to use because of the confusing way it kept asking to store a password. I used it because it seemed convenient to store my passwords. The auto fill invariably used to enter an old password which made it tedious to maintain. It is now entirely useless since they updated to the browser version. I will be removing it and use something more reliable and less frustrating. I was willing to give it a try but honestly it's no longer worth the bother.

This is an update of an earlier review. Already several months I have been using Dashlane in the paid version, after good experiences with the free version. I started with a monthly fee and wanted to switch to an annual subscription. Now I have already paid the annual fee twice and they still, also, book my monthly fees. As I saw at other complainers, their customer service is a bot and further non-existing. You just do not get an answer when sending an e-mail. It is about #1409855 dated 3 February and #1422142 dated 20 February.

Software is crap, crap crap. Won’t work on my computer had to fight with them to get a refund. I got it. Now they are going to charge my credit card $5.00 a month for a premium subscription on software that does not work nor is it on my computer. Emailed them and said I had to log in on my account to cancel. Problem is I do not have an account. F@#k me!,

Review.Titre: Save yourself the misery, don’t get this app!
Review.Contenu: If you need to share passwords—- DO NOT GET this app!They make you sign up for free and then if you want to share your password with anyone, they will sign you up to a subscription until you find out the sharing feature does NOT work. Extremely glitcy app on mac. They also failed to refund anything although I complained within 30 days of signing up.I don’t recommend it. Try something else, save yourself the misery.

Downloaded Dashlane on my Mac and during set up realised the free app wasn't capable of meeting my needs. So uninstalled the app. However, now, when I go to fill in a password the window still pops open to ask if I want it on Dashlane - in other words, it rather craftily refuses to be totally uninstalled.I would never trust a piece of software that's obviously designed not to be easy to get rid of!Update: Ok - got it now. Thanks.

Review.Titre: The new default web app is a disaster!
Review.Contenu: The new default web app is a disaster!Many essential features such as credential info and VPN doesn't work on the web app. The web interface is much more prone to scam and illicit interfering by keyloggers and phishing and such. Why did I even pay for this? The desktop app worked fine. It's mindwrecking how you can mess up this bad. I'm moving to Bitwarden, which is a free alternative that works so much better. Also, please flag this review so I can prove that I purchased a 24 months premium service (stupid me, I know). Shame, really.

They immediately take your money. If you have a Support issue, forget it. You will spend hours with them on chat, because they don't have phone support and they don't use services such as Logmein. They will send you an email and you respond saying that the email doesn't solve the problem. And then a couple of days later, another email that doesn't solve the issue. And so it goes, for days, and weeks or longer. Your money is gone !!!!!!!!!!!!!

Review.Titre: Dashlane awful software and customer service
Review.Contenu: I used Dashlane business for my company, as a password manager it was awful, my entire team had issues with it and wasted countless hours trying to work with it. It would generate passwords and not save them, and when using with Firefox on Linux it would never auto fill. I requested a refund after 3 months in to a 12 month contract and they refused to give the refund even tho we are not going to be using their terrible software. Please do not get Dashlane there are much better and cheaper password managers out there.

Purchased Dashlane software based largely on online reviews.  Installed fine, but unfortunately when I went to actually change a password, the menu option to do so was missing.  Worked with Dashlane customer support opening two separate tickets, they had me waste hours uninstalling and reinstalling the software, to no avail. Never worked.  Then when I asked for a refund, they refused.  Worst experience with a software app in years.

Review.Titre: The idea is great and the VPN works…
Review.Contenu: The idea is great and the VPN works fine but it can't ever give me the right password. Every site that requires a login ends up with at least seven different passwords, each of which are wrong. Nobody can seem to figure out where it's getting this information and I've spent significantly more time going through the lost password process than I did before I used it. The issue is consistent across my Mac, PC and iPhone. Just use Chrome to remember passwords and get a better VPN.

Introduced to this last year. Even before we deployed it I thought it was overkill for our needs. That thought has not changed.  I see many great reviews on here but I'm not convinced by any of them.  We have a couple hundred employees and only a handful are using it. And I am not one of them! On a number of occasions it has failed and those staff that had installed it found they could no longer get through their daily tasks because they couldn't get access to any of the websites.  I've seen and used a lot of software applications in my 35 years in IT and this one will not get my seal of approval.

Review.Titre: SUB STANDARD NO CUSTOMER SUPPORT A FRAUD
Review.Contenu: Although this program no doubt has value to others, for me it was a total loser. For one thing, they do not have Phone support, which is a major flaw considering the difficulty of its programs. And even though they promote chat rooms as a substitute, their version of a mutual chat room is a farce. I was promised a refund it the program did not work for me, but until now, they have been ignoring me which is a major mistake on their part. I do not intend to relent until they live by their word, unsubscribe me and return my money.

AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE.This app is useless and because it is so full of bugs it is now causing me serious issues. Changed a very significant password and now the app wont recognize my password to let me back in.Only use if you like risking your data.As a reply to the Dashlane response - I did raise a ticket with support. It took over 24 hours for a response and then it was boilerplate and totally ignored the issue. Just reinforces my comments.The final comment from Dashlane support is they cannot recover the lost password but hope that doesn’t put me off Dashlane. Lastpass installed and all passwords transferred.

Review.Titre: I've had this software for a couple of …
Review.Contenu: I've had this software for a couple of years now and it was okay. Most of the time, it did not fill in forms correctly and a number of other issues.  Then, Dashlane had me install some sort of one-click function and since it has ceased to function at all.  I have had to resort to pen and paper.  Dashlane's support has been abysmal.  At this point, I'm just trying to install it so that I can export my data to LastPass.Kevin

Since i use dashlane, my life turn in Hell.It duplicate site and password, doesn't update password sync. I get lock out and violate site because the sync doesn't work well. On domain, it's terrible, every new sub domain, DL create a new password, within a week you have 20 time the same password entered and when you change your domain password, you have to manually change them all. Don't forget one or you will violate your password.I can't believe people even consider it.  And it's one of the best ????

I didn't last any time with this application. It's horrible.  It takes over your computer and adds websites indiscriminately.  You have to service the application, rather than the other way around.  Using chat support was useless.  The advice given and followed ended with my not being able to access my own account to delete websites and passwords.  WORST experience ever.

Review.Titre: iOS app no longer functions properly
Review.Contenu: App no longer functions properly. I contacted their customer service email to report the issue with a video.Rita just gave me the run around, weeks of trying to explain the buttons no longer work on the iOS app to her responding she doesn't understand. For other companies you can go straight to the development team for app issues to be fixed.So Rita is either a bot or imbecile. Either way I can't use the app properly anymore as I can't tap on the buttons.It's great when it works, but when it doesn't you're left paying for an inferior product.

Review.Titre: Was good, now it is bad.
Review.Contenu: Recent update to the free tier are hurting paid users.I share password with contractors who use free tier. Due to recent limitation to free tier they are now unable to update the password because of the 25 limit.Absolute madness.

Customer service can be slow.  I had a recent technical issue that seemed to resolve itself a few days after I reinstalled the browser extension.  It wasn't immediate that it began working again but by the time customer service responded to me, it was.  If I had the free version I wouldn't mind but since I pay for it, it can be frustrating.  It can also be a little wonky to use.  It is a little nuts sometimes that the way it works.

While customer support was apologetic for my renewal concerns they still did not address the real problem. When you send me an email that says you will be debiting my bank account on Nov. 2nd and then debit it 3 days earlier on Oct. 31st it overdrew my account and cost me a $37.00 overdraft fee. This account is used for internet purchases only and the money goes in on the first of the month. And the only reason I am giving you 2 stars is because even though support was a week responding they did add an extra month to my subscription.  You need to do better.

Review.Titre: Put my sons data at risk
Review.Contenu: I am a full family plan owner and have been for a few years now. Until now everything has been great. The service is slick, easy to use and covers everything I and my family need. I would have been happy to promote them to any friends or family members.My son is part of the family plan and uses the service to store many passwords. Recently despite still being part of my paid in advance family plan, his access was removed with no notification, advanced warning or explanation. He had to remove stored passwords in order to comply with Dashlane's demands that he abide by the limits for the free version.I checked all details and he is still registered as part of the family plan so I contacted Dashlane. They have ignored all attempts to contact them and resolve whatever issue they have on their side. It's a disgrace.When you promote your brand as the security home for customer's families, you take responsibility for helping keep them safe. Especially when you take their money to do so.Dashlane you should be ashamed, I will be looking to remove the subscription and claim a refund as you are not protecting my family as described

Review.Titre: I had help chats with 4 different…
Review.Contenu: I had help chats with 4 different techs.  The first three were no help at all.  Finally the last asked me which operating system I was using and suggested I update it.  Sure enough that worked.  The first 2 hours I spent with the other reps were miserable.

Review.Titre: Used to be a great password manager
Review.Contenu: Used to be a great password manager, but by god it's getting more infuriating to use by the day. Removal of the desktop app was a kick in the backside as the extension isn't the most reliable item out there. Either with delayed prompts so you're not updating the password, or it just clusters itself around and you have duplicates of incorrect passwords. Mobile app isn't much better, doesn't accurately give you prompts to enter your information even after enabling access to do so. Really is just getting worse over time

Read the issue that the customer is facing and don't rely on your self-help answers and a Bot to to resolve issues. I was at the point of moving to Nord for my password protection. If I have to go through this again my family and I will drop your service. I spent a week attempting to get a resolution. There is no immediate response for help, it comes hours later. I guess you have a very small operation.

Review.Titre: Support Could Not Fix My Problem
Review.Contenu: Support was not able to duplicate or fix my problem. None of the suggested solutions worked so I had to figure out a work around to my problem on my own. A few days went by with no communication and then my issue resolved on it's own. I ultimately reached out to support to let them know I no longer needed assistance.

How is there not group sharing on the family plan? The whole idea of a family plan is that I would like there to be sharing with a group of people. That's the service.Unfortunately, the absence of this group-sharing feature, (which does exist for other plans, just not the family plan for whatever reason) means that I can't rate this highly as this was the exact reason I invested in this service.

Review.Titre: It was extremely hard to actually find…
Review.Contenu: It was extremely hard to actually find a place where i could contact some and work on my problem live'I spent almost am hour cycling thru your web pages trying to find a place I could actually contact somebodyAlso i am very angry that i no longer have my passwords available for edit on my computer - i have to go on your website to do it. As my problem was that i could not log onto your website or the edge icon i could not get on the website to even see what my passwords were. I use this program so i don't have to remember them but if i cant access the icon or web page your program is TOTALLY USLESS

I have a new phone... passwords are not transferred and I had forgotten the master password.  Dashlane will NOT allow you to reset this password without losing everything.  Even Banks have the possiblity of resetting passwords.  If I wouldn't have found the password it would have been a disaster.

Review.Titre: Passable at best, if we're being generous.
Review.Contenu: Passable at best.Lacks extremely basic features such as hardware key 2FA (how? in this day and age?)The autofill functionality is atrocious - sometimes overwrites random fields *and* automatically submits the form; which seems woefully insecure and also extremely frustrating when it happens as it can overwrite and save(!!!) unrelated data - so if it's a critical piece of information you didn't copy beforehand (e.g. a secret key), Dashlane could effectively lose you that key.If you disable the autofill, there's no easy way to trigger a fill of all the relevant fields - instead you need to copy paste each field one at a time.E.g. - you have a login page and you want to select a combination of user / pass from your saved list; you can't just click that saved set of credentials and have Dashlane fill both fields; no, you have to select copy username -> paste, copy password -> paste.It's a *complete* waste of time and makes autofill really necessary which brings us back to the autofill functionality being a disgrace.I guess the best thing I can say about it is that it mostly works. If you don't mind all the ridiculous limitations, the poor UI, if you're not worried about the autofill submitting sensitive data in the wrong places and all that, if Dashlane is the alternative to using the same password all over the internet, sure, Dashlane is better than that.Other than that, I really fail to see any way in which it would be better than literally any other password manager, including free / open source ones.

Long term subscriber, love the product it has been reliable and trouble free.  The two star rating is in reference to a specific customer support response.  Wanted to renew my plan and experienced a payment error issue.  Sent a technical request and received an automated "Dashy" reply that did not come close to addressing my issue.  Tried on my own several more times over two days and the payment finally went through.  After I had already resolved the issue, I received an answer via email from a real person.  Very disappointed with the poor response and the apparent issue with your payment portal.Update:  Understand now that an automated response is the standard from Dashlane but when you are experiencing a problem and get an automated response, one can assume that's all you will get until you try again.  My suggestion, I would rather wait a day or so for a response from a real person than to receive one that is not related to the problem.
The second set of instructions (nothing said to use these???) where convoluted and difficult to comprehend. In several minutes I fixed the issue.
logging in every. single. day. even though I ask it to remember my password for 14 days is getting really really really tedious.
I could not contact a human being about a supposed billing error in order to correct it or change it.

Review.Titre: The inability to speak to helpful live…
Review.Contenu: The inability to speak to helpful live person and the complexity of your instructions  without regard for the skill of the client to interpret and execute them diminish your otherwise excellent product.

My SSO wasn't working.After using the chat, they escalated the call to the next level of support and advise me that I would be reached soon with help.  The help only came 3 weeks after this.  I had to divert alot of internal ressources to get this critical service back up and running without Dashlanes experienced support staff.  When reached, they were able to point me to an efficient dirrection that I was not able to find in the help section at the time.

This review combines my own experience and my husband’s experience. For me, I found Dashlane’s integration with iOS to be good, but I found its desktop applications (including browser extension) to be buggy from time to time. My husband’s experience on the other hand was a nightmare. He basically was never able to use Dashlane after creating an account and was charged before his free trial was up. I switched to Bitwarden which has been really stable and the UX has been fine once I got used to it.

Review.Titre: What has happened to what I wrote…
Review.Contenu: What has happened to what I wrote before I started to read your guidelines for reviewers and looked at the Guidelines for reviewers?  I am finding Dashlane VERY difficult to deal with. When I started with Dashlane I found it quite simple and useable but I now I over 80 I cannot follow the instructions.  However I need to use the internet so must use passwords.

Review.Titre: sorting out renewal was a disaster!

Review.Contenu: There is a saying that if it's not broke don't fix it, well that applies to Dashlane.  It was such a good app when it was on the desktop and so easy to use.  Everytime I need a password I have to go to Dashlane.com and log in and by the time it takes to do that, I could be logged in if I only remembered the stinking password.  Why can't you bring back the old DASHLANE for those of us who prefer it and find it easier to use?  Not sure I will be spending the money I do for another year of frustration!

Review.Contenu: Not happy with service, does not work as advertised, does not work on all major websites. Causes issues. Review.Contenu: LOST MY MASTER PASSWORD TWICE IN LESS THAN A YEAR AND IT WAS NOT SOMETHING I DID.  I WOULDN'T SUGGESS THIS PASSWORD SAVER TO ANYONE.  GET A FREE ONE AS THEY HAVE THE SAME BENEFITS. Great - when it works. Problems: doesn’t always save passwords. Doesn’t always sync between devices. Randomly asks you to save changes when no changes have been made. Saves passwords (again) that have already been saved so that you’re not sure which is the right entry. Auto-fill doesn’t always work.

I find the program was very difficult to work with when you had technical difficulty . My company uses Dashlane, our business account got deactivated. According to the Dashlane rep, this was  caused by a bank error. This caused all of our shared passwords to be deleted. Review.Titre: It would be great if it worked all time.
Review.Contenu: I loved dashlane so I subscribed fir the higher-priced above the free one it never worked I paid for it but when I checked on it when it was due again they said they could not find where I paid. so I told them to just sign ?e up for the free one it has come up about 3 times rest of time I have to enter the password so for me it is not worth the hassle

Completely unreliable no matter how many times one uninstalls, reinstalls, updates, etc..  When it works, Dashlane is a good manager, but it either suddenly stops working, won't accept autofills or balks when proper two-step sign-ins are the order.  It simply is NOT a reliable program.

I have downloaded the free version tonight and tried about 5 sites to test it out. I couldn't get it to consistently enter in the information.Sometimes it stored the Client Id and not the password , sometimes neither and occasionally it worked. No idea why it didnt work every time.

Never works when you need it to,  generating new strong passwords in the sign in field instead of putting in your actual password, and then not updating your new strong password when you're actually changing a password...headache

Review.Titre: Dashlane works okay but leaving is a pain.
Review.Contenu: Dashlane works okay, but if you choose to leave, it's going to be a nightmare. Not only do modern browsers not import passwords from Dashlane, but Dashlane itself fails to generate valid CSV password files. It doesn't escape characters when exporting to CSV correctly. The CSVs it generates are missing headers in the first line for column names. And there are lines within the same CSV that have different numbers of fields.The RFC 4180 standard for CSV files is whole 6 pages long so it's really marvellous that we're entrusting our security to people who cannot follow through with that.

Review.Titre: As a premium user of 18 mos I was…
Review.Contenu: As a premium user of 18 mos I was surprised by the ill-prepared roll out of the web app with is flawed losing almost all of the intuitive functionality of the resident applications.  I re-upped for another year, unfortunately, before experiencing the disappointing performance of the web app. Customer service/support is abysmal.  No matter how chronic or real your tech or account related problem is, you will be dealing with an automaton until some entity. in my case "Peter" (not sure he's real) comes back with non-answers.  After reading the glowing positive ratings I ask Trustpilot, how do you detect  Dashlane employee's and/or shills?

When I first started using Dashlane 3 years ago I loved it. I could click on the dashlane icon on the internet and it would enter my user name and password for the appropriate account. However about 6 months ago there was an upgrade and now every time I try to use it online, it will not put in my saved passwords and try to just auto fill my name and address. If I want my user name and password I have to log into the dashlane app and not use the internet dashlane link. I now use my Apple password auto save for my passwords and log into most of my accounts.

Review.Titre: I love your program- but when you…
Review.Contenu: I love your program- but when you upgraded and went to the new system for mac you left me out.  I have legacy software that does not allow me to upgrade.  I understand you have to keep up but should not have let us older system users hanging out to dry.

Review.Titre: The support is no good if the programme is crap
Review.Contenu: I have had a series of problems with Dashlane which fails to open at irregular intervals and has to be deleted and reloaded. The suport is quite good but frankly should not be neccessary.

We are forced to use it in our company and I only made bad experiences with it so far. -rep: The app does not work on Linux-rep: Not even the web app does work properly on Linux, passwords are arriving delayed or not at all-rep: People share passwords without a possibility do display them. Review.Titre: I have been a Dashlane Business user…
Review.Contenu: I have been a Dashlane Business user with multiplle employee licenses for over 3-years. Although it takes a little getting use to, it works as intented. HOWEVER, my MAC had a system upgrade which caused me to download the Desktop version and when I did that, it asked for a new password. Well, I have a system and I DO NOT forget, especially when you write it down, Dashlane failed. Now, I cant even get anyone to reply to an email, a call or something. I have to reset all my password and NO HELP from anyone. Their ROBOTS may be sophisticated, but we need human help. Be careful with your MAC updated and don't count on their support, it does not exist.

My dissatisfaction with Dashlane concerns the company's incompetent communications and unhelpful support.  Was not always this way; seems to me to have changed in the last year.  Dashlane relies on the "We're receiving lots of requests for help...back to you as soon as possible" excuse for not providing its user's timely help.  I expect that it is true that the company is receiving a high volume of help requests - most likely because the company is creating this volume with its poor customer communications, which typically raise more questions than they answer.  Easy problem to solve, imo, but I doubt that Dashlane management will do so.  Effective communications?  What's that?

Review.Titre: Barely the thing it was before.
Review.Contenu: Barely the thing it was before.Before 2020, Dashlane was great - easy to navigate, easy to use, overall - good. I used it for a few days, then forgot about it. Now I got tired of remembering passwords and bought Dashlane Premium. Yeah, bad choice. Not only it is absolutely terribly hard to navigate, but it is also extremely inconvenient. And I can't even submit a refund request - I try, and then get an automated email that offers me to fix problems with Dashlane Premium instead. FAQ section is terrible, usage is terrible, quite literally - everything now is barely the barebones of what Dashlane was before.Edit:Here's all support requests that I've submitted so far.138982613923101401705
1. Preferred the offline App. Hate using the online web version.2. It will not except my password anymore.3. Yearly charge too expensive for a password manager.Decided to stop using due to the above.

The auto-fill and auto-sign-on on features are unreliable. They never work for my bank (Chase), and work intermittently for various other sites depending on whether I am on an iPhone or a (Windows-based) computer.  When auto-sign-on won’t work, the copy/paste function for my password works maybe 45% of the time. I have actually changed strong passwords generated by this app to weak ones that I can remember because I can’t count on the app. Which kind of defeats the purpose.  The overall hassle factor is (perhaps, barely) less than without this password-saving  app, but it is still unacceptably high. I am actively looking for a better app.

Review.Titre: I really want to like it...but
Review.Contenu: I really wish Dashlane worked.  I switched from RoboForm because I love the idea that if something bad happened to me, my wife could request access to my passwords.  Great feature.  It's the actual filling of passwords that sucks.  it doesn't work for about 1/3 of the sites I visit. I use FF and Chrome on a Mac.  Don't know how well the PC versions work.Just getting the list of potential passwords to popup for a site is a challenge.  About 1/3 of the time, I have to launch the Dashlane client, search for the website, then copy and paste the password.Thinking about going back to RoboForm and jsut putting my master password in my will.

Review.Titre: DO NOT EVER Forget your password
Review.Contenu: DO NOT EVER Forget your password.  I have, unfortunately and basically have to figure out all my password or create new ones for 200+ accounts.  Help is only online with computer chosen suggestions.
Very boorish custommer suport. Teaching me how to behave. The only good thing is their money-back guarantee, which I had to use. Which is the reason for the 2 stars, and not 1 star

I'm instinctively wary of password managers but I finally bite the bullet and decided to install one so I can access my passwords over all devices. Read review after review across multiple sites, Dashlane come highly recommended as one of the best. If this is 1 of the best I dread to think what the others are like because this is awful. I've been fighting with this damn thing for about 8 months. Yes I have browser extensions, yes everything is up to date.It's been getting worse and worse but the final straw is it now doesn't even recognize live.com to log me in to my emails. The only reason it gets 2 stars is because of the extra features but the new VPN is buggy as hell.  DON'T BUY.

I have a hard time with Dashlane working when I need it.  It is slow, sits there and does nothing.  It's hard to even log back in again.  I needs more work done to it.  It also needs to be compatible with Windows 10.

After a month of researching i decided to go with Dashlane. At first set-up was a little confusing (tutorial would have helped). Where I initially had a problem is when i tried to add or edit the on-line ID or password for one on my accounts. Every time I tried the Dashlane app would close.I decided to contact Dashlane help desk (you would think there would be a link in the app but I had to go to their website.  After 20 minutes with the 1st tech support i was disconnected and not contacted (what’s the point of confirming your e-mail if they are not going to follow up).  I followed their instructions to delete and reinstall the app with the assurance the chat help would still be available - NOT.I was excited about the potential of this app and moving from a trial to Family membership.  This decision may have to wait.
- Annoying popups- Can't remember when I don't want to save- After Windows login I need to login to dashlane!- Can't save password without email- duplicate billment on paypal, support doies not react

I love DashLane on my MacBook Air,  hate it on my Samsung Galaxy6 phone.  The phone version  is clunky, cumbersome and pretty much unusable.  Chrome is my browser of choice on both devices.  I cannot recommend.

Extremely unreliable.  Seems to get worse with each update.  On more and more sights it simply does not work to autofill passwords.  I spend a lot of time doing workarounds and fixes for this password manager.

I think the base product is very promising and well designed, however it has a number of issues which just never seem to be fixed (even though dozens of users have written to Dashlane about the problems).  They are more focussed on adding new features than they are getting the product working and at the moment, it's almost unusable for many people due to a set of long standing bugs and problems. Dashlane are fully aware of all the issues, but their response is always the same "we will look into this" - but they never actually do. The product has got significantly worse since I first started using it, which is a great shame. I hope one day a change of product manager will mean a change of priorities for the developers.

As a "Premium" user of Dashlane for a number of years I expect more than a program that works sometimes and sometimes not. For several it was mostly trouble free. I liked it so much that I purchased a multi-year Premium account. Then, sadly, Dashlane stopped performing with Safari, my mail browser with my Mac. Sure I can use Chrome or Firefox but Safari if my browser of choice, It was supposed to work with Safari and once it did. Now is it at best sporadic. For an expense program I am so disappointed that I would advise potential users to wait until ALL of the bugs are worked out. The developers have been working on the problem since February to no avail! I certainly hope that they can fix the problem before I need to jump to another password manager.

Previously, I used to largely appreciate and was satisfied with Dashlane, though even while being logged in, I had to mostly copy my login details and paste them where they didn't populate the fields, or did so erroneously.  It did make managing a ridiculous number of passwords easy to manage overall.The problem arises when you need support in a timely and functional fashion.  No telephone support and limited email support and a buggy chat option await you here.  I appreciate the help I did receive from the agents I had, but don't expect your being back up to business in no time!  You might see only a few responses every 24 hours.  In verifying your identity, you'll be asked to upload your passport/license.  If that process doesn't work, don't email your documents!  One of the first rule of Internet is do not email your driver's license!

Review.Titre: Disastrous after the stopped desktop app support
Review.Contenu: I have been using premium for years. Once they stopped supporting the desktop app and moved to web extension only, it has been a disaster. It works great like 85% of the time, but it's a password keeper! I use it so much, that means it's causing a problem of some sort at least once a day. Autofill is intrusive and tries to fill fields where it doesn't belong. It tries to autologin everywhere immediately as a default, so you miss messages on the login screen or get errors when there is a recaptcha. The iOS app is glitchy and I end up having to do everything manually. But the WORST is that it does not always save new passwords it generates! It has glitched between the time it autogenerates a new password and when it saves. It also has overwritten a one password with a different one on the same domain. None of this happened before. It's a total mess and I am getting out of this service even though I have a lot of prepaid months left.

More than 7 days and they don't give me any answer on how to access all my passwords, because the two-factor authentication in the app is broken.I been using Dashlane for more than a year with my time and works OK to save your passwords.  I enabled two-factor authentication, and brought a U2F key and set up and saved my recovery codes, and worked correctly, one day my iPhone broke up and was unable to use the authentication codes from the app, so try to use the U2F key and the app kept asking for the codes from the app, so wanted to use the recover codes provided when setup to factor authentication, but the app don't give you any option to do so, so try to contact support and it's been 7 days, without any answer.  You can image the problem that you put all your passwords in the same place for a year, and then support don't want to help, and they don't care if you can access any of your passwords.

I have been using Dashline as a paying customer for several years. I recently sent a support query and after several days I received a standard reply which did not answer my questions, I replied saying that they had not answered my query and a couple of days after that I got a customer satisfaction email for my closed query! Any company that thinks they can deal with customers in that way deserves to fail and unfortunately, I think Dashlane will soon be in trouble, especially now that they have decided to go for a browser-only solution which a lot of customers are unhappy about.EDIT I have noted the reply from Dashlane which us similar to most of their other replies, I am NOT going to update my report with this information as Dashlane does not seem to report back with any updates themselves. However, I am happy to confirm that I am now using an alternative product that seems as good as Dashlane and that assuming it continues to perform well I will be moving to that soon and abandoning my Dashlane subscription which still has several months to go

Review.Titre: I really want to be positive..
Review.Contenu: I really want to provide a positive review, because when Dashlane works, its fantastic. But herein lies the problem. It never works properly. I have used this on many devices, Android phones, iPhones, MacBooks & Windows PCs. Not one of these operates as it should.On Mac, the auto login or fingerprint login never works and for every device, the majority of the time it does not recognise and log you into websites. You either have to reload the page and hope it picks it up or you just end up opening the application every time, looking for your password to manually copy the password and into the website. A very temperamental offering. And there is next to no support from the support team. Each time I log an issue I am told that my issues only affect a minority so therefore its not a priority. Great. However I have used Dashlane premium for around 3 years now and not one of these issues has ever been fixed!I definitely will not be renewing and switching to an alternative, like LastPass, which has always worked as intended when I have used for business
Dash lane keeps filling numbers on new applications. It is impossible to shut it off easily when you are trying to put in new info.

Honestly, Mary was very pleasant and she tried to help. However, in the end, and after nearly two months of endless emails and convoluted instructions, I finally was able to resolve the problems myself. I have repeatedly said that what Dashlane lacks and is sorely in need of is telephone support, or the ability to remotely access customer computers to resolve complex problems that the average user cannot resolve. I have a string of emails that has to be in the 30-40 email range since mid-April. It had gotten so long and confusing, I could not even locate a recent email from Mary because it was buried in a barrage of lengthy emails between me, Mary, Roxanne, and I don't know who else. Again, Mary did her best, so this is no reflection on her, but I am extremely dissatisfied with the way in which Dashlane is set up to resolve technical problems. It is just unacceptable, and it is one of the main reasons that I may not renew when my subscription expires next spring. Your employees are not being provided the tools they need to resolve problems. It is simply not their fault that customer service is deficient.Dr. Ralph Perrino

Review.Titre: Dashlane Web Plugin App Is Just Plain Dumb
Review.Contenu: I loved the Windows App for Dashlane. I could update everything offline when I am flying all over the world, and do it all offline with the Windows App. When I land I can sync and then I am done. But this always-on and connected world we live in is crazy and very hackable. My other complaint with Dashane is they are now heavily dependent on third-party browser developers and their security policies, preferences, and updates. In recent times both Firefox and Chrome made major changes to their APIs that invalidated lots of plugins. Allowing my browser to be part password facilitator and password controlling operator for my passwords makes me feel less safe, there is always a browser backdoor despite the robust security claims Dashlane makes. But with the Dashlane Windows app, which is dead now, you can choose not to integrate Dashlane with your browser for the most ultimate security. Using Dashlane in standalone mode, with an occasional sync is the best way to go.  I am going to 1PASSWORD now at 1password.com just because they have an offline Windows app and web plugin. Getting rid of the Dashlane Windows app is just plain dumb and has killed a once-great program.
Thank you for your reply. i would indeed love to contact your Help centre if you could give me an email address.

Review.Titre: Did not work consistently across all of my devices.  Failed on Android device.
Review.Contenu: I'd have to say that if a great amount of my business was not handled through my smartphone, Dashlane would have been a perfect product for me.  Unfortunately, I paid for a year of premium service to have the convenience of having all of my data synced across platforms,  but it constantly failed to work on my android device. At the end of the day what should be a seamless password population process. It would turn into a long troubleshooting session to try and get the mobile app to work.  Ultimately, I had to default to manually log in to the web application to extract the passwords.  Not too much of a convenience anymore... I tried to engage with customer service, who sadly demonstrated that they did not read the case notes.  When I referenced my case number they would engage into a painful process of having me explain to them (in a text chat since there is no phone customer service) everything that was already explained in detail on the notes of the ticket.  Solutions were band aids that always failed and my mobile app never worked consistently. To this day, an L3 still has a ticket open and unresolved.

Review.Titre: I use firefox and haven't been able to use dashlane for 2 months now.
Review.Contenu: When I can get it to work it's great but I'm unable to use it on firefox as it won't show up.

Review.Titre: I have been locked and I am sure I have…
Review.Contenu: I have been locked and I am sure I have used the correct password and the back up is dreadful.

Review.Titre: Poor security, TOO easy to use
Review.Contenu: Dashlane Chrome extension logs in to sites too easilly without you even noticing or requiring to type your master password! After importing 600+ passwords from CSV-file, the option "require master password for this site" is turned off by default and there is no way to turn it on by default for all passwords at once, zo you'll  have to do this for each stored password individually. The Chrome extension doesn't lock after a timeout, so once you're logged on, any site you visit will be automagically logged on to. So if you leave your browser unattended for a short or even a long time, all your accounts are exposed. Even in the premium version, I can't find any way to change 2-factor authentication to anything other than a code sent to your e-mail at every new logon to Dashlane. Google authenticator, Authy, nor verification via text message are not supported. Passwordt can't be grouped into categories, it's just one long list of passwords.Secure notes can be opened without typing your master password, so they're not secure at all.There is no option to add an emergency contact to access your account. PRO's:Importing passwords from CSV went pretty much flawless. Dashlane's VPN on mobile seems to work fine, so Dashlane is cheaper than Lastpass+NordVPN combined, but more expensive than just LastPass. VPN won't work on Chrome OS though.
