Dashlane not working today,have to type passwords in,has done this every so often lately

I just started using Dashlane. Initially I liked it so I signed up for premium. This was before I had a chance to interface with customer support. I was very surprised to find out there was no chat or telephone contact available. Only email. I had a "minor problem" regarding a feature missing in Apple's ios. I emailed them and kept getting canned responses. Finally someone answered and said they were aware of the problem and the feature was deliberately missing and they were working on a fix. The next day a different agent emailed me with an entirely opposite answer. Referred me to a web site which explained how to do it. Unfortunately I had already seen that site and that was what made me aware that the feature Reset Master Password on the Ios app was missing. Two response two answers no solution. The problem was not that serious to me but it did give me a taste of their service. I am well within the 30 day cancellation window and emailed them to cancel my account and refund my money. I notice that there agents frequent this board. I have not gotten a response yet and would like to ask the agent how do I find out when these actions will take place. Especially the refund.I am updating this review. I received an excellent response from Helena which has now satisfied me. With regards to the ticket number It is #1296144. Please disregard it as I no longer wish to cancel my subscription.

Review.Titre: Forgot master password- support non existent
Review.Contenu: Absolutely bloody useless support. The whole point of my issue was that I’d forgotten the master password for the account and therefore couldn’t log in, so then I’d set up another account and wanted my premium subscription transferring across to my new account. This was done after emailing them identification. I then needed my passwords that I had saved on the account and asked for them to be transferred across. I end up getting an email from IT support asking me to log into the old account with my master password and disable 2factor authentication- the whole point of this exercise was that I’d forgotten my master password on the old account and I just wanted the passwords sent to me. IT support obviously do not read the previous conversations with customer services!Because Dashlane customer services has been so shockingly poor and the application itself still has bugs I’ve resorted to the old fashioned method of writing my passwords in a notebook and keeping that under lock and key.I won’t be renewing my subscription with them and I will not be recommending them to family or friends, however I have informed them that I will be writing an honest review about Dashlane on Trustpilot especially the poor customer service the experience and lack of IT support who fail to acknowledge the original source of the queryUpdate: Since posting this review, I have now received a full refund outside the 30 days redemption policy.

Review.Titre: Terrible customer service (with a positive update)
Review.Contenu: About a week ago, I did a Windows Update on my computer. Since then, I have lost the ability to use Dashlane. I have contacted Dashlane customer service 3 times since, the first of which caused me to lose all of my Dashlane saved passwords, and still have no service. I have been promised contact with "Level 2 support," and told this would be labeled "Urgent," but I think this is just a blow-off. I couldn't be told how soon I would have contact, just that "Lever 2" would send me an email which, several days later, still hasn't happened. Some urgency! Dashlane worked great up until this happened, which is the only reason I'm still waiting, but not much longer. There has to be some other comparable service out there.UPDATE (a few days later):A day or two after posting the critical review above, I received emails from a couple of people at Dashlane customer service. I don't know if it was just my point in the queue, or the criticism caused someone to notice my issues, but regardless, I was promised that my service request would finally be considered by Level 2 support. After a couple more days and a few emails back and forth, my problems with Dashlane were solved.I want to thank those people at Dashlane who worked out the bugs in the system and returned by password vault complete and in working condition.As of now, I am back to being a satisfied Dashlane customer.

Have had Dashlane (for Mac), Premium (paid), for some years. It has never been great but now is deteriorating quite rapidly. The main – and worsening – problem with the system is its instability and unreliability in auto-filling login page fields. This feature was one of the main reasons I purchased Dashlane. I estimate that on average to begin with, and until about 6-9 months ago, auto-filling fields was performed successfully in about 70% of instances. That rate has now fallen to less than 40% and now I pretty much expect auto-filling will NOT be performed at any attempt to access my sites.The DL support group are quick to help, offering trouble-shooting advice, but that cannot win against software which is defective. I get fed up with having to do support-troubleshooting every few weeks and am getting increasingly annoyed at the inability of Dashlane to perform properly – or, actually, perform at all – in auto-filling access details at login pages.A second niggle is that despite promises a long time ago that two-factor logins would be offered through the Dashlane system, it still is not possible as far as I can tell to get Dashlane to log in to my banks and other high security sites which have two-factor access systems.I am now investigating alternative Password/login systems, despite having a long period remaining on my Dashlane premium subscription.Message to Dashlane:  I'm not interested in bells and whistles when the basic, crucial parts of the software don't work properly. Stop adding unnecessary gizmos and focus on the basics.

Review.Titre: I dont like the new version were you…
Review.Contenu: I dont like the new version were you cant download it

Review.Titre: I have been using Dashlane for 6 months…
Review.Contenu: I have been using Dashlane for 6 months now and I am not impressed.  Firstly, the only option given to subscribe for a year and not monthly is indefensible and is purely to tie customers in.Secondly, after 6 months of trying everything I can think of, and with largely useless help from Dashlane support, the Android app on my mobile simply does not work.  Not once in 6 months has it either populated any login field or taken me to the relevant password when I tap the Dashlane logo that appears next to a login field.  Not once. Ever.  I have to login in Dashlane using the Master Password every single time, even within a few minutes, look up the password, and copy and paste it.Thirdly, although Dashlane works on my laptop using Windows 10, it only works some of the time.  Often it does not recognise a website, ebay for instance seems to fool it for some reason, email browser is another.  I then have to copy and paste the login details, then Dashlane asks if I want to save the details, it does and I get a duplicate entry.  Same thing next time I log in.Also there are really annoying missing features.  No facility to 'click and copy' anything other than the password is one.  Bank sites often ask for a customer number, etc, with no Dashlane field to enter this other than in 'notes' which has no option to copy.  Another, the 'secondary login' field has never worked for me.And I have paid £70 a year for this.  Clearly Dashlane know that if they offered a month subscription users would cancel.I have now installed LastPass on my mobile which works every time without issue.  As soon as my annual subscription is up I am jumping ship.

First, let me state that I've managed technical helpdesks for over twenty years, so I know what I'm talking about. Also know that the issue still exists - there was no change in status which resulted from this chat session.Communication skills: Low. More accurate to say very low. Descriptions were imprecise - often (exclusively?) limited to "it". I was left wondering what "it" was with almost every sentence. And those sentences seldom made grammatical sense, although they were full of technical jargon. Having worked for Microsoft and Intel, among several other Fortune 100s, and having taught adult-level technical classes as a trained educator, I can tell you that even this tech's jargon was misapplied. This led me to wonder if this tech knew what he was talking about at a technical level. Desire to fix the problem: Low. I wasn't guided through a single activity step, even though I asked for such. Any sort of interrogation with regards to the nature of what I was experiencing was not once performed. It felt like this tech just wanted to meander through this session with no desire to attain any real results, and it felt like I was being talked at, rather than being co-engaged in any useful exploratory process. Incomprehensible jargon-strewn word salad finally led me to draw the session to a premature close.Baiting the ref: In the tens of thousands of technical calls I've personally handled throughout my career, I never once asked for a good review, nor did I ever have to. That sort of thing never leaves me with a good feeling - fortunately, I seldom see it occur.Lastly, this was my second attempt to find an answer to this situation. The first attempt, some months ago, also ended in a patently unsatisfying dead end.

I actually like the product and the concept.  I find the help function, compatibility with IOS and ease of understanding how to get things done exasperating.  For example, I received a notice from Intralinks that I needed to change my password.  I set it months ago with Dashlane (after much exasperation!) and now cannot figure out how to get the “password changer” to work and change my password.  Is it even possible to do so with IOS?   Of course there are no customer service people to call for help so I will now wander around until I find a fix or simply not use Dashlane for this website.  I like the concept of a VPN but have yet to figure out “how” to turn it on and determine if it is working.  Does it stay on all the time?  If not, how should I use it? How do I know if it is on? My wife has also signed up for Dashlane.  I am pretty sure we do not need to both sign up but cannot figure out how to discontinue her account and make certain we are not losing anything.  I am a Premium member.  Between the two of us we probably have only been able to use Dashlane to protect 10-15 passwords.  Again, no one to call.  I have used the chat function and the people are helpful but it is difficult to explain problems and get useful answers.  To be honest, I have spent many hours trying to make Dashlane work for me and will probably invest more time but I wish I had never started this project.4/3/20. Dashlane followed up my initial review, told me the site where I wanted to change passwords was not supported and that I would have to go on the site, change the password myself, go to Dashlane, type in the new password and then save it.  As I initially said, this entire exercise was exasperating!  Although the tech personnel who correspond with me via their “online only, written, help desk” always seem cordial, Dashlane over promises and under delivers.
Canned answers. No individual attention.

Review.Titre: Good feature set and security, POOR quality on desktop
Review.Contenu: Feature-wise, it is a proper password manager with rich feature set and what seems to be a sound threat model with modern cryptography. Works very well on mobile.However - the desktop (Windows) version is just BAD. It is *horribly slow* and hangs often (in my case, I have to kill it from taskman circa every 5 days - sometimes multiple times during a single session). On my non-SGX-enabled PC this is somewhat better, but still painful. Even on a pretty powerful PC with 32gigs of RAM, this is still very noticeable. Not to mention the penalty the web extension incurs on the web browser...This is NOT what I would expect from a paid, professional product, especially since the desktop app performance is something easy to optimize one would think... After spending over 2 years with Dashlane and hoping that a new version will improve, I am slowly giving up – It starts to look as if only a full app rewrite could help here (again – mobile version is pretty decent) :(---Extra features I am missing:- Ability to adapt rules/tag 'missing' fields as sth to be filled (e.g. credit card input routinely fails to recognize expiry date or CVV)- A handy "dismiss autofill" option next to autofill, so that if one wants the form gone - they do not need to cxl it each time they navigate between fields- Localization (or at least full country list). It is ridiculous, that each time I enter a bank account, I need to go back and edit the country to 'Poland' (global preferences do not acknowledge its existence)- Ability to use multiple domains/URLs for a single password entry (or to link them together). Currently, for the autofill to work, I need to have 2 entries for: amazon.com and amazon.de, for example... though they're using a *single* Amazon account. Password health dashboard recognizes this as password reuse... which makes it impractical (I have about 30 accounts like this, so I need to manually check what is legitimate reuse and what is not)

Review.Titre: It was good... until Dashlane stopped innovating
Review.Contenu: Today on 11th Mar 2021, I switched from Dashlane to 1Password after my 3-year contract with Dashlane expired. I managed to get a $99 USD / 3Y deal in Sep 2017 and also managed to get several months added on for free by Dashlane when I recommended it to a friend and he signed up too.I started to look for a Password Manager back in 2017 because managing so many passwords in an Excel spreadsheet, which sat inside a TrueCrypt container, which sat in my Dropbox, just became too much! So the switch over was a massive relief. However, since 2020 onwards, Dashlane became more and more frustrating to use because it seemed as if the company stopped innovating. The tool didn’t keep up with how websites have evolved, which in turns affects it’s performance in day to day use. I will give a few examples.1. Password Browser Extension[Speed] - The extension became too slow and didn’t work around 30% of the time (my estimation as I don’t have the data). This was one of the most maddening things because if the Dashlane suggestions don’t appear quickly enough, you have to manually go to the app and copy and paste them both. This is the same as using a spreadsheet or free local password manager! [Multiple IDs] - Another problem was that I have multiple IDs for some websites for business and personal use. These would also cause problems in appearing quickly which was very frustrating.2. Synchronization Speed between App, Extension and iOS AppWhen updating or changing a username or password in the Dashlane Desktop App, the web extension would not instantly sync about 70% of the time. It was weird because you know the sync has worked when the indicator spins around, but the only way it seems to appear in the password suggestion box in the browser was if you either log out and log back into the extension, or if you wait for a few hours the extension somehow starts to work. I could never figure out why this happened because I have never lost any data after hitting the sync button in this scenario. However, autosync never guaranteed that the data would instantly be updated in the extension either. Once again, this drove me crazy as each month of my contract went by. (My contract started to feel like Shawshank Redemption, just waiting for the day I could escape). 3. No Tags or FoldersAs I signed up for more software and services over the years, Dashlane’s ‘Categories’ for managing passwords became next to useless. You could never see a nice list of the categories on the left hand side of the App. Towards the end, I never bothered to use the categories function because it was useless. On top of that, as my parents are getting older, some kind of folder or tag functionality became critical because their email and other accounts got bundled in with mine too. 1Password has taken a much better approach by providing not only Tags, but also different Vaults as well, so you can keep Work, Parents, Personal data separate, as a few examples. 4. VPN was uselessOne of the features which was touted by Dashlane back in 2017 when I signed up was the integrated VPN. However, on the few occasions I tried to use it when I was overseas, it was too slow and you also cannot decide the location of the VPN. The location of the VPN is one of the most important features so that you can use services that are geo-blocked. [The Positive part of my experience]Wherever there is bad, there is also good, so here are the list of things that I liked about Dashlane in the 3 years I have been a customer:- Dashlane NEVER lost any data. That is absolutely fundamental with any piece of software that is looking after the crown jewels of your data. They have also not had any security incidents that I am aware of. Even though their sync is slow and terrible, I always knew that if I entered data into one of the apps and manually hit sync, it would show up eventually on all my devices, even if it took an hour or two. - Being able to select the colours of my payment cards stored in the app was fantastic as I am a very visual person. Dashlane also automatically selects the colour of your passport which is also fantastic as I am a dual citizen and need to get the right passport details quickly when I am booking travel. - The overall UI design for the desktop and iOS apps were nice. (The extension is terrible though).[Summary]In 2021, I would not recommend choosing Dashlane because it has seen zero innovation over the past few years. There are better solutions like 1Password on the market. Dashlane was good when it launched, but I would not recommend it today.

Was absolutely terrific several years back but has gone downhill lately.  The constant reminder about quality of your Master Password is annoying.  Does not work reliably with my iPhone browsers about 50 % of the time. And the current failure of the ability to organize your list of passwords by "last used" indicates a lack of testing for upgrades.  Help desk is fairly responsive.

Review.Titre: I do not like that Dashlane keeps…
Review.Contenu: I do not like that Dashlane keeps asking me to change my password and I just changed it. I am the only one using this computer, it does not need to be changed as often as you want me to change it. I do not like that the autofill for certain online credit card transactions gets in the way when I am using a different credit card. I do not like that every single time I have to restart or reboot my computer, Dashlane asks me the same questions about the browser extension, which I already have, opening an account, which I already have, and getting a new version of Dashlane, which I already have. Stop already!

Review.Titre: Response to messaged query was slow
Review.Contenu: Response to messaged query was slow. I had already found the answer to my query before receiving customer services response. The information regarding details of my plan were not easily findable, and I would expect to be able to find details such as name of plan,premium, cover,renewal date without much effort.

The biggest issue with this service is customer support.  Live chat works only for basics and there is no phone support. I've had the service for three years and at every renewal, there is a problem (likely because the emails you receive don't directly align to your plan). For a service handling your most private/secure information, you would expect better.

My phone was stolen and I lost access to my Dashlane account because I activated 2FA and the authentication app was on the stolen phone. It took 2 weeks to recover my account. I like the fact that you guys take security seriously but customer service reaction time is way too slow. For something as important as the password manager, 2 weeks is not acceptable. By the end of 2 weeks, I have just about manually changed most of the passwords that I need.

Typically, I find much of the support to be what I call “Poke and Hope” as some of the representatives just provide a link that “explains” the process. What I have learned through over fifty years of education work, not ALL people absorb and/or retain written direction when they initially do not have the depth of knowledge, skill and ability to do the process. I readily accept and admit to being well within that group. The support staff needs to recognize that the user needs to DEMONSTRATE the ability to follow the directions rather than simply thinking they do know how to perform the tasks.

Review.Titre: Lack of phone support; Safari issues
Review.Contenu: Biggest problem for me is customer support...only available via email.  Lack of phone support is really an issue as problems aren't fixed quickly.Also be aware that Safari browser is not as well supported as other browsers.  I've been told by Dashlane support that autofill functionality on Safari will not be supported to extent that it is on other browsers.

Review.Titre: I was able to finally able to resolve…
Review.Contenu: I was able to finally able to resolve my issues. However, it could likely have been done with a 5 minute phone call as opposed to multiple days of back and forth via email.  That was super frustrating.

Review.Titre: I didn’t like all the obstacles you impose to getting effective customer service
Review.Contenu: I didn’t like that I couldn’t find what I needed in your support section and that, when I engaged your AI chat bot, it kept referring me back to the information I just read that wasn’t responsive to my situation! When I finally connected with a real person, it required several back and forth emails before they understood what my problem was and were able to provide meaningful guidance. It took way too much time and effort to get a simple issue addressed!

Review.Titre: Good Password Manager with its deficits
Review.Contenu: + Good Password Manager+ Support is very responsive and helpful- had many issues with the payment to extend the family abonement. First was not working at all, than we accidently bought new premium abonements. However they have been refunded.- Dashlane become pretty eypensive. We consider to move after the abonement expires.

Review.Titre: I like the app and find it very useful however……
Review.Contenu: I like the app and find it very useful. However, I am not as technical as some of the language used when searching help topics. Developers need to understand that users have an extremely broad range of experience and need to explain terminology better.

While Mike in customer service did a good job following up, this issue shouldn't have reached that point in the first place.  Like other sites/software, Dashlane should enable you to download and store back-up codes in the event you forget your MPW.  That would save everyone a ton of time.

Review.Titre: Technical support to fix an important issue
Review.Contenu: The macOS application has been working so good until a couple of weeks ago. Now it crashes before starting, so I can't use it to store and use the credentials saved in the web. The solution provided was to upgrade the OS, which it's not possible anymore. So, I'm waiting for a suitable solution to continue using the application. I hope technical support can help me to keep on using this app

Extremely helpful. But on follow up got the impression he was under pressure, I understood I was being advised to do what he initially had said not to do. Anyway all seems ok now..Inital help quick and excellent. Thanks

Review.Titre: For a customer to come it is essential
Review.Contenu: For a customer to come it is essential, to know ALL standard programs to work smoothly together with your product. I've got the answer, but only after insisting for it. That's not the ideal way. And important: a customer is NOT automatically an IT expert, thus it is not sufficient to answer with "termini technici", but with daily used words. Therefore a living human beeing is far better in understanding and service than a dummy AI which is NOT intelligent, but just reproductive.

Review.Titre: Email support is slow in a pinch
Review.Contenu: We use Dashlane business and heavily rely on it to be there when we need passwords.  I logged in yesterday and the password for our ERP server was gone on Chrome and my iOS device.  Luckily I tried Edge and it was there, so probably a caching issue.  I'm glad id did not have to wait on support because the server I was trying to get into was down!Anyhow, this experience is making me second guess a few things about Dashlane.  1. Email support is slow in a pinch.  2.Have you considered snapshots so we could go back in case something like this happens.Thanks!

It looks like, like other Support Desks, that they expect from you having plenty of time for figuring out all the details yourself. You raise a question but get a link to an articles as “solution”.In my case, it wasn’t.

Review.Titre: This product is a bit expensive
Review.Contenu: This product is a bit expensive.  They do not offer Military discounts or any discounts. Some of the documents on file do not autofill.

Review.Titre: Hits and miss - the vendor needs to listen
Review.Contenu: Pro's- problem was solved- professional and calmCon's- Support by email/chat only goes so far, and is extremely time intensive for the customer and the vendor. Vendor support process should flip to phone/zoom support much earlier without needing the customer to push- I have a high IQ, but the use of two apps (dashlane and authenticator) and confusing authenticator onboarding is unnecessary and confusing

Review.Titre: I was unable to access my account for…
Review.Contenu: I was unable to access my account for 2.5 days. I had multiple attempts at contacting support staff with no response other than an auto-generated email. The troubleshooting links were not useful.

Review.Titre: I thought there was rather a long delay…
Review.Contenu: I thought there was rather a long delay in response and 24 hours later it seemed to have resolved, so I can't say I got assistance really.  Perhaps it is the time difference between countries and the fact that it was on Friday.
Will disappear from the computer after logging onCannot talk with cust. serv directlyCumbersome at times
The person that helped me (Jorge) was polite and truly tried to be helpful. However, none of the suggestions fixed the issue of my Autofill working and then not working on certain sites.

Review.Titre: Support from DL is not at the right level nor 24/7 :(
Review.Contenu: We use DL for our company and when it works it works fine, but when encountering issues we are not happy! they dont have a "follow the sun" support desk so in the EU you get only response after 15:00. then they give you a single option  for try (why not all the relevant options  at once?) and don't take the effort to ask what has been tried so far.   if current issues dont get solved soon we have to switch AND start a claim for the damage caused...On req of DL: #2010007

Review.Titre: Poor knowledge of first line Customer Support
Review.Contenu: I raised a simple question about a dark web alert and got a timely response from Dashlane Customer Support. The support person seemed to struggle with answering my question and, after 6 email rounds, I requested to speak to a supervisor who immediately provided a clear response to my question.

Review.Titre: DASHLANE OkayOn many websites it fills in…
Review.Contenu: On many websites it fills in immediately, but there webs that it won’t save the PWAlso if you are working on a desk top there is no fast way to retrieve a PW. You’ll need to open a browser to go to your PWs or Payment inforj

Review.Titre: I have trouble signing in to some…
Review.Contenu: I have trouble signing in to some things when dashlane gets involved and makes it difficult for me to insert information.  I would prefer to ask for this to happen rather than what is happening.

Review.Titre: It was very difficult to get my…
Review.Contenu: It was very difficult to get my husband's Dashlane account off my computer.  I have a Mac and it was almost impossible to use Safari ~ Finally got the app to work on Firefox.

Review.Titre: Support is slow to respond and the program is glitchy
Review.Contenu: The program always has something not working quite right and it takes a few days to get to the bottom of it with support. Looking for alternatives.

Customer service was very courteous, professional, helpful and relatively timely (within 1-2 day response times).  Product user experience was not as intuitive as I had hoped.  Frustrating to find features, controls and settings necessary to have the service meet my firm's needs.  Self help online often didn't quite synch or match with the current product / service which led to dead ends in self service problem solving which was frustrating and time consuming.  Maintaining synchronization there could save customers quite a bit of time and drive down Dashlane's support costs.

Review.Titre: I am generally very pleased with…
Review.Contenu: I am generally very pleased with Dashlane.  However, your lack of human customer support is shameful.  I’m having issues that I cannot resolve without technical support.
It took multiple tries to get the solution.  Initially my problem was misdiagnosed by a BOT. It took a human to understand the real issue.
Had problems turning off self generating passwords.

Review.Titre: Good support only after a layer of…
Review.Contenu: Good support only after a layer of automatic replies that were not helpful.
The iPad Dashlane app has become very slow to load and react. Has there been an update?

Review.Titre: I would prefer phone support that is…
Review.Contenu: I would prefer phone support that is immediate. Email support takes way too much time.
I am  travel agent. I don't understand computers. I wanted someone to walk me through it. That didn't happen.

Review.Titre: No phone contact number with easy…
Review.Contenu: No phone contact number with easy access to a live person.

Review.Titre: There is NO excuse for the poor…
Review.Contenu: There is NO excuse for the poor performance on Safari!
As I have the programme installed, an links you give only opens the Vault's Web App

Review.Titre: Dashlane requested me to open a…
Review.Contenu: Dashlane requested me to open a secondary payment method. This brought me problems, because I was not allowed by Dashlane to use my standard login.Please make it more clear! I had cost me now days to resolve.

Review.Titre: The helpdesk did a great job
Review.Contenu: The helpdesk did a great job, but I had difficulty transferring my existing self invented passwords to Dashlane, probably my lack of computer litteracy🙃
Once I spoke with a live tech, problem was Fairly easily solved

Review.Titre: I really liked Dashlane when the…
Review.Contenu: I really liked Dashlane when the database was on local computers. I see some benefits that is current but I have mixed feelings about that. I liked the password generator that came with the original Dashlane program.
Good place to store the words but support is poor.

Review.Titre: There is plenty of room for error
Review.Contenu: There is plenty of room for error. Don’t ask me now. I don’t like surveys

Review.Titre: Li was very helpful on chat and really…
Review.Contenu: Li was very helpful on chat and really tried to solve the problems.The main problem with some ot the suggestions is tha I do not know enught to do some of the actions that may help solve the problems. If I have pc problem then I call my source and he takes over my PC and solves or removes the problems. this is easy and requires little input from ME.

Review.Titre: Good, but could and should be better
Review.Contenu: In general, I like Dashlane for its features and security reviews.  What I don't like is the reliability of the mobile applications for Iphone and Ipad.  I have experienced three separate issues over the course of the five years I have been using Dashlane, to include the last several years as a Premium customer.  When I report the issue, I am usually treated like someone who has absolutely no technical knowledge or savvy, and in the most recent case, was told my problem could not be duplicated by Dashlane technical reps until my issue was elevated, which is when I received an apologetic email.  I also don't like that I cannot speak to a human being when I am paying $60 a year.  I have spend WAY too much time trading emails and taking screen shots and having my questions and comments misinterpreted when I could be discussing this with someone on the phone.

I am very disappointed andd at times frustrated with your new "roll-out:.  Maybe because of the many years I have used the old format.  Two things that immediately come to mind, no alphabet index to search for passwords. No password generator if there is it is very well hidden.  Have trouble logging in at times.

Review.Titre: Cannot enter new categories in web app
Review.Contenu: I generally like Dashlane but I'm only giving three stars because they eliminated the desktop app without having the ability to add or edit categories in the web app. They also can't provide a date when this will be available, so the web app is less functional than the old desktop app, which worked great.

Review.Titre: The support specialist was helpful once…
Review.Contenu: The support specialist was helpful once I could get to her. It is irritating that it requires an email and waiting a day to speak to a person because the automated solutions are never helpful, and searching through FAQs never turns over the exact problem that I’m facing. It’s just a needless delay.

After several years of using Dashlane Free and being happy with it, I upgraded to Dashlane Premium, primarily to get the included VPN.  I am not at all impressed with the Hotspot Shield VPN.  It is very limited in the time it can be used each day.  It wants me to upgrade and pay the Hotspot company for the upgrade!!  What kind of a scheme is this?  Is Dashlane TRYING to displease their customers who upgrade?  Why do you insult your customers with a third-party VPN that can be used only an hour or two each day?

Review.Titre: The business app works great. The management portal needs a better overview.
Review.Contenu: The business app works great. The management portal needs a better overview.Made a ticket for the support desk to provide feedback on the use of the management portal. Finding invoices and settings is harder for the app keeps sending you to the wrong admin portal. But the support desk just send standard answers with explanation. A shame to see that the app works great but the support doesnt take time to read your complaint/question.

Review.Titre: Opinion: nStill have problems getting dashlane to
Review.Contenu: Still have problems getting dashlane to come up when in a site when I need to change or create a new password. Some sites it will not come up at all. Apo still has growing pains. When it works it the best thing since sliced bread. Problem is it still doesn't do as it should more than half the time. Discouraging because I love the app. Have used others but like this one the most.

Review.Titre: And if the internet goes down...?
Review.Contenu: Recent updates seem designed to make things easier for Dashlane than the end user. Like no more desktop app - but what happens to my notes if the Internet goes down? But this seems to be a trend, and all PW managers are migrating to cloud only for desktop. Lower dev costs, I guess.App is working correctly, after an update done since my original review. Dashlane is great about keeping their product up to date!

Review.Titre: Perfect for iOS but not so much on the Mac
Review.Contenu: I think everything is fine on iOS but on the Mac, for safari at least the browser plug-in is quite buggy so think removing the desktop app is unfortunately going to make me need to reconsider using Dashlane. I’ll see how it goes as I’ve said everything else seems perfect but the plug-in experience is so poor it drags everything else down. Anyone that needs an iOS solution should go ahead. If you need a Mac solution proceed with caution.

Good product, but would be vastly better if they had live phone support.  Especially for us Seniors who have trouble navigating through all the closing and opening of web pages.  I disconnected from them twice while trying to solve an issue.  The computer bots are absolutely worthless at customer service, ditch them and put in some phone lines…really!

Review.Titre: I thought it took more back and forth…
Review.Contenu: I thought it took more back and forth to resolve my issue.  It seems to me you could have people answer personal questions instead of or in addition to the two you asked -- name of computer & date started Dashlane.  I never could come up with the second one.  I appreciate the high security -- that's why I use it, but when emails come and go, there must be an easier way for people to prove they are who they are.

Review.Titre: Problems With New Version, Support Lacking
Review.Contenu: I had very few issues with Dashlane until I recently updated my Mac IOS and installed a new version. I've had bizarre behavior since then. I'm a Premium member and reached out to Dashlane support twice, but have received no responses. I'd give you one star today, but averaged that with the 5 stars I would have given a month ago prior to these problems.

The Desktop App was great, slick great UI, The web app is clunky, impossible to use and a general disaster, doesn't auto log out and to find or amend password is clunky and complicated. If they don't sort it soon I'm off to something else been with it for 6 years but the new web app is dreadful

like others, I also don't like the new built-in mode in the browser. For example, I don't always have automatic compilation. Then I have to open the app, search for the site, copy the login. Then reopen the app, search for the site again, copy the password. And some other problems like writing notes. I also thought about changing the password manager but there is no possibility to export the stored passwords (better in json format) neither in Windows nor on the smartphone.

Review.Titre: Excellent password manager, with a few niggles.
Review.Contenu: I preferred the old application based Dashlane to the current browser version.  It made it easy to see security data whilst viewing a website form.  Now I have to switch back and forth between two tabs. I can't see what problem this change was supposed to solve.I have never managed to get the mobile autofill to work.Otherwise I think Dashlane is excellent, keeping all my passwords secure.  I have now changed all my old "memorable" passwords, many of which were duplicated.  Autofill, when it works, is very useful.

Review.Titre: After a loss of all data subsequent to…
Review.Contenu: After a loss of all data subsequent to a PC internal cleaning, I was unable to recover 100 or so of passwords that had been generated by Dashlane.The support team helped me to recover the data but once again it appears to be lost.  I shall go back and follow the support recommendations once again.

Not intuitive.  Wish they had a user's manual.  Have had this program for many years and still do not know how to use 90% of it's capabilities.  Customer service does not exist.  When I run into a program I have to live with it.  Current changes have only made it more difficult to use.

overall a good service. Passwords have been secure and accessible in other platforms. Integration with iPhone is ok, but browser add ons are erratic and inconsistent. For example, Dashlane will recognize some sites, and offer to generate passwords. Other (many) times it will not and info has to be recorded manually. Dashlane can also be very stubborn and get in the way of filling forms.

It's not always consistent.  I just tried to register a product and opened Dashlane and it wouldn't populate the registration page with a password.  I couldn't even copy and paste successfully.  This occurs fairly often.  I don't know the fix.  I do have apple keychain and even though I tell it not to populate the password, Dashlane lays over and dies.  Don't know why?

Review.Titre: I was glad to use Dashlane
Review.Contenu: I was glad to use Dashlane, following a recommendation by The NY Times. I stuck with it for years, but it never was what I think of as easy to use. I’m actually transitioning to another manager, 1Password. It seems to be a lot more user friendly. Price was one factor. Dashlane seems to be one of the more expensive out there. But when it comes down to it, ease of use won the day.

Dashlane doesn't always update my passwords.  I started with the free Dashlane quite sometime ago and upgraded to premium which was good for awhile then it wasn't updating changes in passwords.  I cancelled premium for awhile, then decided to try again, but still don't see that it updates new passwords so think I'll not renew again.

I'm not happy with the new web based system. I am very worried about it's security. The PC based system no longer working at all is very troubling. Auto fill works sporadically and auto save for new websites never works. I loved the old system. I'll wait and see if this one improves.

Review.Titre: I have been using Dashlane paid version…
Review.Contenu: I have been using Dashlane paid version for about 6 months. Overall not a bad product but I have issues with the sync between the app and the web based interface. It works but it’s too slow and not realisable so I have ended up resetting my passwords many times. The interface really needs more work and improvement.

Often doesn't work. Takes too long to load on startup. Ignores requests to stop working on a page. Forgets accounts. Ignores requests to not show their logo in input fields. And tops it off by introducing a new ugly logo. The only thing that keeps me using it is my reluctance to take on the grief of migrating to something else.

Need and love the concept.  But sometimes it works and sometimes it does not.  I love it when I open my webpages and Dashlane immediately comes up and opens it for me.  So why does it NOT open my Visa account but it does my bank account?  Also the created passwords are so outrageous, I can barely type them much less remember them.  If I have to look it up and type it in, it will take me minutes instead of seconds to do it.

It is very convenient to be able to have many passwords and to not have to memorize or note each one.  Dashlane stores my logins and passwords for me.  The downside:  Frequently Dashlane does not auto fill the login/pw fields on my pc or my mobile device and I have to go the Dashlane app and copy and paste them myself notwithstanding I have paid for a premium membership for the past 2 years.  I am considering not continuing my Dashlane account when it comes due for renewal

Dashlane works o.k. But a lot of features don't work on many web pages. I find that I have to do a lot of manual work to get it right. The one important feature missing in Dashlane is a password generator on demand by the user. That's for passwords for sites where Dashlane's automatics don't work.

Review.Titre: Dashlane is a great product, BUT ...…
Review.Contenu: Dashlane is a great product and service, however, the cost for keeping passwords synced across all platforms and devices is too expensive. I would like to see pricing based on the number of devices synced. Now I just keep my top passwords on each device and any new ones or less used ones, I keep in a journal.

Review.Titre: I really like Dashlane but there are…
Review.Contenu: I really like Dashlane but there are web sites that try to login to and and the name and password won't populate. So I have to go into the details in my Dashlane website and get the password etc and sign i manually. I have checked the help section in Dashland and it didn't help. This used to work flawlessly but not any more. I am sure there is an answer to fix this but I can't find it. I am keeping Dashland and hoping the issues can be solved. I am hoping that a Dashland tech see's this and offers a solution.

Review.Titre: I would have rated Dashlane much higher…
Review.Contenu: I would have rated Dashlane much higher except for the volume of fumbles. By this I mean the times Dashlane won’t fill in the required information, seems to disappear completely and won’t work with some websites. This is irritating to depend on a password manager that works about 80% of the time.

Too often, Dashlane confuses User Names and Passwords and it seems it wants to save User Names as Passwords. I confess I don't let it generate passwords. I prefer to come up with my own which it generally accepts as Strong and which I list in code, e.g. lamb means the reg. no. of a Lambretta scooter I once had, and 63 address is the number and road where I lived in 1963

Reliably secureI have been a user for a few years. First of a free version then of the paid one. The Chrome extension is not as consistent in populating credentials at log on, as I would like it see. Since it uses 2 way verification, I found myself in a very difficult situation when my phone got broken while traveling. Tech support could not figure out how to verify my identity without my phone and that left me in a very precarious position. I wish they had some secure, but practical alternatives that rely less on technology.

Review.Titre: Good but some limitations compared to Keeper
Review.Contenu: I have download the app with a view to change from Keeper . installation and getting setup is a brise, Unfortunately it fails on 2 accounts compared to Keeper. 1) one cannot add a file to a financial record - only to Notes.B) you cannot view the attachment on the fly, has to be downloaded to a file on your phone and then view from the file it has been downloaded to. very long winded. Also reading some reviews on the web it appears not be be as secured as Keeper. Shame otherwise I would have jumped ship.

Have been using Dashlane for over a year now we find it quite buggy. Having said this reading the reviews of other password managers it seems as if all this type of software is only good for very basic use. In our experience we find that Dashlane fails to sync, log in correctly or update passwords correctly about 20% of the time the other 80% it works correctly.Use the free version but consider very carefully before you pay out as in our experience, it is not yet the robust password manager it may one day be.

Make that 3.5 stars. because it is finally staying on my computer without my having to re-boot all the time.But, up until now if I added a password on my computer it would show up in my phone app., on my iPad app.,and on my other computer. Now I have to add it to each one separately.

Review.Titre: Great untill screensaver turns it off
Review.Contenu: Dashlane positively works wonderfully....until I am logged off by not using my computer for a half hour. Even thou Daslane settings have me logged in for up to 10 hours, I get logged off often when screen saver pops on.To log back on I must close Dashlane (only accomplished by control/alt/delete) and restart and relog into program.

sometimes fills in passwords automatically and sometimes it doesn't.  I can go to the program, copy the password and paste it and it works, but I shouldn't have to do that.  Also, most of the time when I tell the program to go to the website, it fails to log me in.

Love the presentation, the portability of passwords across devices, and the security.  BUT, when I try to use the auto login feature with the web pages from the password section, either in safari or with the dashlane browser on my iphone or ipad, it does not work.  This feature working would get you to five stars.

Review.Titre: After 50 words it is the end of the…
Review.Contenu: After 50 words it is the end of the line. I am not even a bussiness person. If I upgrade the price is rathe expensive for a retired person. Not happy that I can not continue without paying anrather high price.

Review.Titre: I've tried unsuccessfully to find my passwords through enrollment in Dashlane.
Review.Contenu: I've tried unsuccessfully to find my old passwords through what I thought I had with Dashlane. After several times of entering a wrong P.W., I have to get another. When I've gone to my trusted Dashlane, I'm not able to locate them. Now, I must confess it has to be me, because I have been able to locate some of them, and I do have faith that Dashlane will help me resolve my issues here. I've even tried to reach a live help server through Dashlane, in order to get tutoring. I know I'll receive service through YOU!!

Product is very good, but customer support is not.  Have problem with tablet and only correspondence is email.  It takes 2 days for each response and i am constantly referred to documentation - the same one multiple times.  Working in my next response. #1174741

Review.Titre: Good product with modern UI but big issues
Review.Contenu: Good product with modern UI. Works in Android and Chrome, but there are big issues with couple of things.1. Autologin is horrible idea and you cannot turn it off globally. And because bug, not even per site. Why is it a horrible idea? Because it sometimes submit wrong forms, not the login form. And that makes some sites basically unusable: you autofill the login form with Dashlane and it automatically submits wrong form. Thus you cannot login at all.2. Saving passwords from Android is nonexistent. When you create new account for a new app, or new website Dashlane doesn't understand to save it. Instead you have to do it manually.

Review.Titre: use to work great but now will not open …
Review.Contenu: use to work great but now will not open up or work at all.have been working with help dept for over a week & they still have not fixed problem. have not heard back from they in 2 days. hope they get it fixed soon. wish you could talk to a person instead of working over internet

Review.Titre: Some worrisome problems but easy to…
Review.Contenu: Some worrisome problems but easy to use. Very worrisome, password to login to dashlane stored in database and appears stored with all the other passwords. Seems easy for hack and login. Problems generating new passwords for a company and adding them correctly to database.

Awful customer service via online support, refused to believe I had a problem logging into their trial system (due to conflict between 2 different versions of their system I was trialling). This was despite extensive screenshots proving the issue existed.Then, when the trial period ended (I hadn't been able to trial the software due to the issue), they refused to extend the trial period.Shocking, because I could have had 100 users on the system if they had bothered to show some respect to a genuine error.**** EDIT ****Was sorted out after this review was picked up, so all fine.

Review.Titre: Dashlane could benefit from some revisions
Review.Contenu: Dashlane fills a very important need to remember passwords.  Unfortunately, It is slow to load and fails to do basic things, such as enquiring of the user if they are writing a new entry without calling your intention to a duplicate already in your file.

I was hoping to share my passwords across multiplatform devices. On my iPad, as well as on my Android, I would be satisfied by the level of security provided by my fingerprint recognition.  However this convenient technology is not taken advantage of, in favour of an obnoxious and tricky password system.  I don't think I'll renew my yearly subscription. I realise now after Dashlane’s prompt reply to my review that I had overlooked the possibility of enabling biometric security on my portable devices. However I think this should be proposed as the default setting for mobile devices

Review.Titre: Good product fair price however not…
Review.Contenu: Good product fair price however not much customer service and also the app on desktop seems to go really slow now and again forcing me to uninstall and re-install I think i will be using something different after my subscription ends

Review.Titre: I actually love the app and looked into …
Review.Contenu: I actually love the app and looked into subscription but the price is too steep for me.  I have shared my love of this app with others but many stated they get similar services for free.  I will stay with Dashlane and hope I get a subscription for Christmas.

For the longest time Dashlane worked fine filling in my data on internet forms.  Then it suddenly quit.  I deleted the program and re-downloaded it, worked fine for a short while, then it quit again.  When it works it's an excellent tool.Regards ~~Joe Toy

The software is useful but it is less efficient than a few months ago in that it is not opening some sites automatically , it is not sincronizing and or prompting password changes. As a result, many tasks that were automatically done now require manual work
Problem now fixed!
I find that sometimes i have to turn it off, espescially if it's trying to generate its own passwords when not needed.Sometimes puts in its own user name...etc so have to keep a close eye on that.

I requested help with regards to using some of their literature to disseminate to a group of prospective consumer clients. My request was not urgent.The response time was a bit long, but I was explained this was due to heavy assistance requirements subsequent to an update.Once, responded to, the assistance was clear and thorough.

Easy and clear use.It's an easy to use app, clear structured.Good offer for the premium, that has extra advantages, like premium VPN included.Issues with the autofill, where you need to go a lot of times in the app and manually search for the password you need. More an inconvenience, but needs mentioning.Will probably go back as premium at some point.

Great browser extension, great mobile app, very friendly and helpful support desk (once you get there).Areas that could use improvement: Payment processing, overly fast automated actions and e-mails in relation to subscriptions and deleting business accounts, user experience / flow dead ends (not in relation to the browser extension or mobile apps; those are fine), missing 24 hours support (you might need to wait until midnight before able to start a live chat).I think if they start with 24 hour technical support, a lot of problems can already be countered before they can become real problems, and it would then be safer for non-American companies to use their services.

I am only giving 4 stars which may be a little harsh however there was a large gap between my initial request for help and a response from Dash Team.However, once the team picked up my query, the response was terrific and my problem was solved!!

Review.Titre: Responses from the support team were…
Review.Contenu: Responses from the support team were not always answering to my questions in a straightforward manner. Unclarity about invoicing process, I had to ask several times the same question to get a clear answer.Other than that, very nice and friendly contact with the support person and pretty responsive.
it took a couple of days but the problem could be solved

Pro:Great to store passwords, perso info like passports, license, etc. If accident, just go to a computer center and log in. Cons: Does not always fill data properly, using the password generator not always easy, distinction between categories not obvious, making or editing certain files not easy. Too many services like vpn. In short:Very useful, easy, portable, works great with cell phones. Does password great but auto password change not obvious.

I like the Dashlane app and having been using for many years.  I decided to upgrade to premium due to changes in their "free" offering.  I didn't give a 5 star because the support was slow to respond to my account issue.  But when they did, they handled it smoothly and all was well.  Hopefully changes to their free version will incentivize others like me to move to premium, thus increasing their revenue and they can hire more peeps to do support!

Review.Titre: I wouldn't say great but I appreciate…
Review.Contenu: I wouldn't say great but I appreciate Peter's taking time to help. Your online ads get really confusing as they are not linked to you customers status. I'm for Premium but you're inundating me with ads and comments about free account. It is really annoying.

Because I'm from the Netherlands and the Dutch language is not supported it is difficult to explain the problems and also it wasn't easy to understand what the supporter Peter wrote to me. All together Peter succeeded to explain what I had to do.

Review.Titre: The experience of the agents was great.
Review.Contenu: The experience of the agents was great.My only, suggestion regarding was 4 stars was the delay between contact. Which would have been fine, however, when you log an issue online, you get a "we have your request" - it would be nice to get an email confirmation also.

Review.Titre: I was contacted by a technical support…
Review.Contenu: I was contacted by a technical support member quickly and they were able to escalate my ticket to the correct resources in a timely manner. Again, thanks for the help with my Dashlane questions.

Review.Titre: Friendly, efficient service by email and live chat
Review.Contenu: Prompt and efficient dealing with an issue. For some reason, after re-installing Firefox I was unable to get Dashlane to operate because I needed a code number. Despite the system repeatedly saying a code had been sent, I was not receiving them. After taking part in an online chat, and later in emails, the problem was rectified by an operative called Rita.

I've used LastPass for ages but after its security issue last year, I looked for an alternative and chose Dashlane. It logs me into sites more smoothly on PC, iphone and Android mobile. Their dedicated 2FA app works well and allows other sites to be added. Their customer support is very responsive and knowledgeable.

Review.Titre: Great product but support needs improvement
Review.Contenu: UPDATE II: #2093584 < Gus was amazing so please give him some praise for resolving my issues. It turned out it was;t just one thing that had gone wrong but a multitude of issues, some of which were caused by me.UPDATE: Since leaving this review a really helpful person from Dashlane's support contacted me and resolved my issues. I'm now back to using a fantastic product that is easily the best on the market BUT they need to improve their support processes. Waiting 48 hours for a response when you can't access any passwords is not great. Fortunately, I had access via my laptop but others might not have that option.Great product but terrible support. I can access my account on my phone but it's not working on Chrome or via their site. I've tried resetting 2FA but it keeps saying there's an error and then if I try and use a recovery code, which I have saved on 2 computers, none of them work. Something is broken and all I can do is fill out a contact form, even though I'm a paying customer.

Clara from the customer support team has been most helpful when I was caught between Google Pay and Dashlane due to some billing issue. She provided great advice and was quick in making decision to shorten my ordeal to resolve the issue. Thank you Clara for your help and going the extra mile !

This rate is more due to Elma's help after spending many days emailing back and forth with the Dashlane team.  Elma helped me change from one email to another, exporting my files to my current account (Family).  It was a frustrating process in the beginning but with Elma's help it went very smoothly.

Support is excellent.I could not find information anywhere on how to delete multiple account logins instead of one at a time.  The reply from support was detailed and thorough and prompt.I have had no problems with operation of the app.  It coordinates well from desktop to phone and tablet, and its secure password sharing when required is perfect.4 stars.  Mainly because I just don't give 5.

Review.Titre: Their support team was helpful and patient…
Review.Contenu: Their support team was incredibly helpful and patient. We had problems with our accounts because the main account changed from personal to business and unfortunately, you have to create another account and pass all your data to the new one. this also is required to the friends and Fam plan people. Part of the Friends & Fam group, us, from the old account, had to delete or reset their accounts and create a new one to have access to the new Friends & Fam plan or incorporate into the business team of the new account.It was kind of nightmarish but Nathália, Dashlane Suppport Rep, was incredibly helpful and patient with all of us.

Review.Titre: It was quite difficult at first, but all worked in the end
Review.Contenu: It was quite difficult at first.  But once Serg got involved and understood my problem it went much more smoothly to resolve my issue.

Review.Titre: I am so glad to have Dashlane
Review.Contenu: I am so glad to have Dashlane.  Dashlane makes life so much easier, for storing/creating passwords.  Without Dashlane, I would have to remember so many passwords.  So helps me not use the same password over and over!

Forgot master password. Was able to reset following directions on web site. The only negative is that once the app on iPad accepted new master password, I could not open the app on iPhone. Finally support answered my email and provide a solution. But it took over 24 hours to respond. This could be avoided if same recovery instructions for a second device would be added to the reset instructions in the help articles.

Dashlane is a great service. I have thoroughly enjoyed it since first starting with the service two years ago and recently upgraded to the family subscription so everyone in my house can take advantage of it.

I always hate the process for auto-renewal of subscriptions--there always seems to be some trickery involved to auto-deduct your account before you've had a chance to confirm the renewal/change your plan. Such was the case with Dashlane, though when I emailed support they did fix the issue, with a courteous reply within a few hours of my request. Thank you.

The "great" part was that Dashlane was able to successfully resolve the problem with my payment. The less-than-great part was that in order to do so, I had to disable my VPN - contrary to best security practices. I sent Dashlane Support a message about the VPN disabling requirement.

Review.Titre: Dashlane is nice when it works
Review.Contenu: Dashlane is nice when it works. It autofills everything for me, generates great passwords, and eliminates the need for me to remember passwords.  However, when it doesn't work right... very slow response from support, and then you're stuck doing the for gotten password thing at every website you go to for days while they get around to getting back to you. My last support request took a day and a half before they even got back to me - let alone resolved the problem. On top of that, Dashlane pretty much just doesn't work on mobile. It's no good on any app, and most of the time it fails to autofill in my Chrome browser, too. Oh, and one last thing, when I go to use a credit card, it won't let you even once without reentering your master password... It's shorter and easier to just type the card number in, so Dashlane is no solution for that.

Review.Titre: The resolution was accurate and helped
Review.Contenu: The resolution was accurate and helped. Yet ultimately, not needing to require a resolution for something very clearly is an issue with Dashlane's system would be better. The issue was, out of the blue, my master password stopped working to log into my accounts anywhere. Whether an app or browser. I did not change my master password either. So definitely something Dashlane was doing on their side system-wide. Regardless, once Dashlane customer support exchanged the solution email, it was easy to remedy.

Im new to Dashlane, although Android phone app still not 100% seamless (still quite good, just not as good as the now less trusted competitor), it is very refreshing that this product has good tech support (unlike the competitor LP). Support was great, timely email reply and specific to issue raised, with follow up emails giving updates on progress - very impressed. Well done Dashlane - enough for me to stay onboard as my now preferred.

I like that Dashlane works across all of my Apple devices. I never have to worry about forgetting a password. I would give Dashlane a perfect 5 stars, but I recently had a technical issue, which tech support did not correct for me. I had to figure the fix out myself.
Good advice.But help centre obviously overloaded. Took a few days to reply

Review.Titre: Most of what you provide me is…
Review.Contenu: Most of what you provide me is excellent. The following are the problems I run into now and then: 1. Setting up a new website username and password, Dashlane does not allow me to save the information occasionally. 2. I use Dashlane to sign in to all my accounts, but the website occasionally tells me the password or username is incorrect. I suspect the website does this to make me change my password.3. At least one site will take just twelve password caricatures. I have the ability to change this on   Dashlane, but I would like to set the number of caricatures as default.4. Giving a date of experiences is impossible because it happens multiple times each month.

★I use google translate.★I am a Japanese who is not good at English.The staff was very understanding and supportive of customers from other countries.If possible, it would be to the benefit of both Dashlane and our customers if you could create a support page with case studies, etc. in Japanese!

It would have been nice to be able to speak with a live agent, rather than a back/forth QnA or a survey.  I hope Dashlane realizes that their solution [except for default iOS "Passwords"] is NOT for the masses.  It can be confusing and cumbersome.  I have many clients (for whom I've turned onto Dashlane) that are continually confused by how Dashlane operates.  As a  simple example.... To get help with my tech-related issue, I had to create a NEW HELP ticket by answering what Rev/Ver software I was using... annd most lay-users would have NO clue.  I'm not saying I have the answers.  Just noticing the areas of opportunity for improvement. Ps. I'm a tech consultant.  I've been using Dashlane for 5+ years.  I reached out to Dashlane for help due to issues with Dashlane working with my Chrome Browser.  All other  web browsers have been working fine.

Review.Titre: Had everything covered for all problems
Review.Contenu: They had everything covered and set out for just about any problem.  The only drawback was that I felt I would have liked to be speaking to an actual person at times as I am quite challenged with technical problems.

The support via EMail is phantastic: on time, friendly, patient, helpful.I made a mistake, booked an account I didn't want to book, got my money back - no problem. It's really amazing, absolutely not a matter of course in this day and age.Thank you!

Very good support, reactive and efficient.(installation of synchronized dashlane on 2 PCs on Windows -firefox, chrome and edge as well-, 2 smartphones and one tablet, with autofilling of fields.It would have been perfect if I would not have to ask support for it !

Review.Titre: Dashlane did what it was supposed to do…
Review.Contenu: Dashlane did what it was supposed to do but didn't have some of the features or layouts I was expecting/wanted.Online customer service is a bit lacking but works.Apart from that its not a bad tool.

Review.Titre: Generally does what it's supposed to
Review.Contenu: Generally does what it's supposed to. With IOS you can't stay logged in. Some sites don't auto-fill properly.Sometimes the three-number code on the back of your credit cards doesn't auto-fill.

Review.Titre: The support team is always courteous…
Review.Contenu: The support team is always courteous and promptly follows up on tickets, even if they require attention from the dev team and may take a week or two to resolve.

Review.Titre: Excellent experience once I was able to…
Review.Contenu: Excellent experience once I was able to speak with a human. AI wasn't suitable for my issue.

I have been using Dashlane for many years. The whole time I had the same master password. I really like the auto fill feature for the sites I go to regularly.  I got an email suggesting I change my master password. I did, but promptly forgot it. I kept trying to log in using my old password. I spent a lot of time going to all my sites to change the passwords and reconnect. What a pain. I almost totally dropped Dashlane. I decided I liked the auto fill feature so much that I started to repopulate this with my new passwords. I also wore down my master password. I very much like this software. Thank you.

Review.Titre: Wish It Could Have Been a 5 Star
Review.Contenu: Customer service gets 5 stars for promptness/accuracy.Dashlane gets 3 stars for taking away a useful tool (category sort) with no notice nor a commitment when it will be returned

Review.Titre: I had to wait less time on the chat…
Review.Contenu: I had to wait less time on the chat than I expected.  Mike understood my problem and patiently waited while I tried what he suggested.  When Dashlane was telling me that what I had done didn’t work, Mike was able to tell me that from his end, it said it HAD worked.  I accidentally closed the chat but was able to figure out the rest of what to do. However, I would really like to talk on the phone with someone.  (I’m old!)

Review.Titre: Great app for keeping track of logons, credit cards, notes, and other stuff
Review.Contenu: The app provides a great way to keep track of logins, credit cards, personal notes, and other information that needs protection.  The only negative for me is that the app allows creation of duplicate information for the same websites.  For example, it would be easier for me if the app asked me when creating a new entry that another entry already existed for the same website or credit card, or whatever.  A simple message such as "An entry already exists for this website" would prevent me from creating duplicates that I then have to review after the fact to determine which is the "real" entry and which is the duplicate because they look exactly the same.

Review.Titre: I could not reset my original password…
Review.Contenu: I could not reset my original password through the site's guidance, but when I sent you an email and you kindly guided me, I was able to easily recover my account and reactivate it.Thank you

Review.Titre: Well its not a 5 star because at first…
Review.Contenu: Well its not a 5 star because at first it didnt seem i would be assisted, but as soon as the desition to help was taken the proccess was simple smooth and easy.
Whenever Dashlane support is needed, it is very responsive, efficient and eager to maintain contact until the right solution to the problem is found.

Review.Titre: Torturous process to get my answer resolved. Your automated email response was returning Dashlane's emails were received as junk and undeliverable.
Review.Contenu: I eventually was able to get my question resolved but it was very difficult and unfriendly experience. I tried the FAQs - no match. I tried the Dashlane Customer Support and the system merely replied to my question with another question. I was deeply disappointed that it was an automated system and no human interface. I finally defaulted to the email approach and waited several days from a reply which didn't come. I resubmitted my question and finally received an answer which solved my problem. Almost a week to get any response that worked. BOTTOM LINE: (1) no phone to call available when in "uncharted waters that FAQs don't address -  BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE, (2) disappointed that a human did not monitor and reply to my question when I accessed the Customer Service Support portal - BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE. (3) lastly, too long a period to reply to my email question - BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE. In summary, Dashlane's help and customer service was the worse I've experienced in this digital world. Love the Dashland system but the bloom is off the rose after this experience.
After a very challenging process to get my premium subscription restored, Peter has managed to get everything sorted out.Thanks
I was introduced by my grandson to Dashlane several years ago. He noticed me looking up a password. He said here is what you need. The best thing I have ever done. I am 80 and confident.

Review.Titre: I was able to talk to someone via zoom
Review.Contenu: I was able to talk to someone via zoom. It's a lot easier to explain technical challenges when support can see my screen.

Review.Titre: Great support, but a tool that needs improvement.
Review.Contenu: The support provided by Khet was exceptional, they solve my issue without problems and receive a refund on the cost for a service my company was not going to be use, so great.Regarding the tool itself, I feel that since the deletion of the desktop tool, some functionalities, or specifically ways to organize password has been utterly neglected, doing a good tool for personal use (maybe), but not for organizations with a lot of passwords for different purposes.
Fast response during business hours.  Initiated refund quickly.  Only wish they had a phone number to contact directly.
Very good customer service. I am giving 4 out of 5  stars just because the service might be faster and because there is no way to get help via phone.
The support got things fixed efficiently.  It would have been nice if they had warned me of this bug with upgrades before I got locked out.

Review.Titre: Support from Carol and Diogo was quick
Review.Contenu: Support from Carol and Diogo was quick, easy to understand and follow.  With their help, the problem was easily resolved.

Review.Titre: I finally got the 2FA code remove to…
Review.Contenu: I finally got the 2FA code remove to use Dashlane on other computer. I wish the explanation for using 2FA was   Easier. I’m happy it.
The reset account process wasn't working correctly. After a talk with support we tried again and it works

Review.Titre: I needed a previous password as I'd…
Review.Contenu: I needed a previous password as I'd accidentally saved the wrong one.   I couldn't access the previous password.   The support team tried to help me, but that information wasn't available.

Review.Titre: The outcome of my issue with Dashlane…
Review.Contenu: The outcome of my issue with Dashlane was successful however the on-line guides were to useful, nor were my first interactions with Dashlane chat.It was only when on-line conversations with Serg and Elma started that we moved towards resolution of my issue

Great support.  But in trying to change my email address was irritating.  It was not clear that I could not change it.  Ity turns out that my email address was my user name and to change that, I'd have to create a new account!  What a pain.  A new account means I'd lose all my rental history!  Had to leave it that way.
Support team was great and kind, and offered me a solution that worked, so thank you! Only thing is it was quite slow (1 or 2 answers per day, it took 4 business days to resolve).
Recently had an issue where 99% of my passwords were missing from the app. Apparently, it was a server issue (not reassuring) Dashlane services were quick to resolve the issue though.

Review.Titre: One of the Best Password Managers Available.
Review.Contenu: The Security is obviously top notch, there's absolutely no doubt about it. But the differentiating factor is Dashlane app's UI. Both the Android and the Web apps are great in terms of their UI/UX. They should just work on the Autofill in the Windows now. From Android 11 onwards, the Autofill on Android is integrated in the Keyboard itself, which is great. But there's no such provision in the Windows version. The Autofill pop up keeps interrupting everytime. Plus disabling that pop up is also a hassle. It would be great if Dashlane could bring a more minimalistic pop up for Autofill in Windows that doesn't interrupt in between while typing. Also, they have recently discontinued the Essentials plan. The minimum plan that you can purchase now is the Premium plan, which I feel is a bit on the expensive side. It would be great if your could bring a more cheaper version of the starting plan. Nevertheless, anyone planning to switch to a Password Manager can choose Dashlane without any hesitation. You will be more than satisfied with their service.
Solution is good, support is grest. I suggest to review the bugs in order to avoid to remove and reinstall periodically the plug-in and the app.

Representative replied within a reasonable time frame and continued to contact me with easy to understand instructions on how to fix problem I was having. Was disappointed that there is no way to actually talk to someone.
The customer service resolved my login issue but required action from my admin, it's too bad because it wasn't our fault.Besides that, excellent service!
Dashlane customer support is helpful,  but I wish there was a number you could call for help as the reply isn't immediate.

I enjoy using Dashlane a lot and it has been very helpful over the years.  The recent transition to its being an Extension on Chrome has been associated with problems requiring me to reinstall the Extension several times.

Review.Titre: Rita was very helpful in solving my…
Review.Contenu: Rita was very helpful in solving my problem. I don't really understand why it occurred in the first place.
Response was quick, but I was able to resolve my issue on my own.  That is why I have not reviewed to this point.

The product generally works well with the exception of some autofill episodes that can be annoying. Customer service team was immediately responsive to solving issues. Recommend Dashlane as a useful tool for password management and OPSEC

Review.Titre: Stuart understanded and helped me very…
Review.Contenu: Stuart understanded and helped me very efficiently.Just a shame that the Dashlane customer service took ione wek to answer.

Review.Titre: It was great until I got a new laptop
Review.Contenu: It was great until I got a new laptop. Now my new laptop won't accept passwords that were saved on Dashlane. Big pain.

Review.Titre: I enjoy having a password keeper
Review.Contenu: I enjoy having a password keeper.  Dashlane foes a good job and has robust features.

Review.Titre: The support was fast and to the point.
Review.Contenu: The support was fast and to the point.The only annoying thing is that I had to type my request three times before I got help. You may want to test your UX flow.

Review.Titre: received a response that solved my…Couldn't accept shared password
Review.Contenu: received a response that solved my problem BUT response time seemed delayed.
